mcrMGTMIB.name: mcrMGTMIB

revisions.description: Added support for SGMII mode on the CM-1110 Module and SNTP authentication
Added support for ex-1CM, CM-4GPT and CM-10GT Media Converter Modules
Added support for CM-10G Media Converter Modules
Added support for PerleView features, alarm/warning table, port status table and tftp file transfer
Added support for advanced switch features and dual-fiber modules

mcrMGTMIB.contactinfo: Postal: Perle Systems Limited 60 Renfrew Drive Markham, Ontario Canada L3R 0E1 http://www.perle.com/
mcrMGTMIB.description: The private MIB module for the Perle Managed Media Converters

YesNoValue.name: YesNoValue
YesNoValue.description: Represents a YES or NO value.

OnOffValue.name: OnOffValue
OnOffValue.description: Represents an ON or OFF value.

EnableDisableValue.name: EnableDisableValue
EnableDisableValue.description: Represents an ON or OFF value.

GenericTableIndex.name: GenericTableIndex
GenericTableIndex.description: An arbitrary value that uniquely identifies the entity. The value should be a small, positive integer. Index values for different entities are not necessarily contiguous.

SlotNumber.name: SlotNumber
SlotNumber.description: Chassis slot number. Valid values are 1 to the highest slot number the chassis supports. For example a MCR-1900 chassis the valid slot numbers are 1 to 19

ContainerStatus.name: ContainerStatus
ContainerStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

AlertSeverityLevel.name: AlertSeverityLevel
AlertSeverityLevel.description: The alert severity level of an event.

mcrChassisTable.name: mcrChassisTable
mcrChassisTable.description: Table of chassis diagnostic type information.

mcrChassisEntry.name: mcrChassisEntry
mcrChassisEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate chassis.

mcrChassisIndex.name: mcrChassisIndex
mcrChassisIndex.description: This object identifies the chassis number.

chassisModelName.name: chassisModelName
chassisModelName.description: This object identifies the name of the chassis model. For the 2-slot chassis, this is the product model.

chassisModelDesc.name: chassisModelDesc
chassisModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the chassis.

chassisSerialNumber.name: chassisSerialNumber
chassisSerialNumber.description: This object identifies the chassis serial number. For the 2-slot chassis, this is writeable (and user-defined). For other chassis, this is read-only (and reflects the chassis' actual serial number).

chassisBootloaderVersion.name: chassisBootloaderVersion
chassisBootloaderVersion.description: This object identifies the chassis bootloader version. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisFirmwareVersion.name: chassisFirmwareVersion
chassisFirmwareVersion.description: This object identifies the chassis firmware version. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisOutStandWarnAlarms.name: chassisOutStandWarnAlarms
chassisOutStandWarnAlarms.description: This object identifies the number of outstanding warnings and alarms for this chassis. If this value is not zero then user intervention is needed to resolve the outstanding warnings and alarms. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisDiagStatus.name: chassisDiagStatus
chassisDiagStatus.description: This object identifies the chassis self-test diagnostics result. It will return zero if it passed and non-zero error code if it failed. The following are possible non-zero error codes: 1 - Firmware download required 2 - Temperature sensor not functional (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisTemperature.name: chassisTemperature
chassisTemperature.description: This object identifies the current temperature of the chassis. The temperature returned will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings. If the temperature returned is -1 then a problem with the temperature sensor has occurred and the current temperature is unknown. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisCfgHighTempThreshold.name: chassisCfgHighTempThreshold
chassisCfgHighTempThreshold.description: This object identifies the chassis temperature high threshold. If the chassis temperature exceeds this threshold then an alert will be generated. The value read/written will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings. The valid range for this threshold is 0 to 70 degrees Celsius or 32 to 158 degrees Fahrenheit. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

chassisReset.name: chassisReset
chassisReset.description: This object allows the resetting of the chassis (all modules). Reading this object always returns 0.

chassisCfgMgmtSlot.name: chassisCfgMgmtSlot
chassisCfgMgmtSlot.description: For the 2-slot chassis, this is the configured slot index of the management module. This value only needs to be changed if the management module is physically installed in slot 2, rather than slot 1. The management module should be restarted after changing this value.

mcrPsmuTable.name: mcrPsmuTable
mcrPsmuTable.description: Table of PSMU (Power Supply Monitoring Unit) diagnostic type information. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

mcrPsmuEntry.name: mcrPsmuEntry
mcrPsmuEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate PSMU.

mcrPsmuIndex.name: mcrPsmuIndex
mcrPsmuIndex.description: This object identifies the PSMU bay as either A or B.

mcrPsmuModelName.name: mcrPsmuModelName
mcrPsmuModelName.description: This object identifies the PSMU model.

mcrPsmuModelDesc.name: mcrPsmuModelDesc
mcrPsmuModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the power supply model present in the chassis

mcrPsmuPsuSerialNumber.name: mcrPsmuPsuSerialNumber
mcrPsmuPsuSerialNumber.description: This object identifies the PSU serial number.

mcrPsmuBootloaderVersion.name: mcrPsmuBootloaderVersion
mcrPsmuBootloaderVersion.description: This object identifies the PSMU bootloader version.

mcrPsmuFirmwareVersion.name: mcrPsmuFirmwareVersion
mcrPsmuFirmwareVersion.description: This object identifies the PSMU firmware version.

mcrPsmuOutStandWarnAlarms.name: mcrPsmuOutStandWarnAlarms
mcrPsmuOutStandWarnAlarms.description: This object identifies the number of outstanding warnings and alarms for this chassis. If this value is not zero then user intervention is needed to resolve the outstanding warnings and alarms

mcrPsmuPsuStatus.name: mcrPsmuPsuStatus
mcrPsmuPsuStatus.description: This object identifies if the PSMU power supply unit (PSU) status.

mcrPsmuPsuVoltage.name: mcrPsmuPsuVoltage
mcrPsmuPsuVoltage.description: This object identifies the current PSU voltage being supplied.

mcrPsmuPsuPowerUsage.name: mcrPsmuPsuPowerUsage
mcrPsmuPsuPowerUsage.description: This object identifies power currently being supplied to the chassis, in milliwatts. A value of 0 indicate that the power supply is not in use

mcrPsmuFanStatus.name: mcrPsmuFanStatus
mcrPsmuFanStatus.description: This object identifies the fan status.

mcrPsmuFanSpeed.name: mcrPsmuFanSpeed
mcrPsmuFanSpeed.description: This object identifies the speed of the fan in RPM.

mcrChassisSlotTable.name: mcrChassisSlotTable
mcrChassisSlotTable.description: Table of chassis slot configuration, status and diagnostic type information.

mcrChassisSlotEntry.name: mcrChassisSlotEntry
mcrChassisSlotEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate slot in a chassis.

mcrChassisSlotIndex.name: mcrChassisSlotIndex
mcrChassisSlotIndex.description: This object identifies the chassis slot number.

mcrUserDefinedModuleName.name: mcrUserDefinedModuleName
mcrUserDefinedModuleName.description: This object identifies the user defined name of the module inserted in the slot. The default name is the model name of the media converter module

mcrModuleModelName.name: mcrModuleModelName
mcrModuleModelName.description: This object identifies the model name of the module inserted in the slot.

mcrUnManagedModuleSlotName.name: mcrUnManagedModuleSlotName
mcrUnManagedModuleSlotName.description: This object identifies the user defined name for an unmanaged module inserted in the slot. Unmanaged modules include all perle C-1000, C-100, C-1110 and c-110 type modules.

mcrModuleSerialNumber.name: mcrModuleSerialNumber
mcrModuleSerialNumber.description: This object identifies the serial number of the module inserted in the slot.

mcrModuleBootloaderVersion.name: mcrModuleBootloaderVersion
mcrModuleBootloaderVersion.description: This object identifies the bootloader version of the module inserted in the slot.

mcrModuleFirmwareVersion.name: mcrModuleFirmwareVersion
mcrModuleFirmwareVersion.description: This object identifies the firmware version of the module inserted in the slot.

mcrModuleoOutStandWarnAlarms.name: mcrModuleoOutStandWarnAlarms
mcrModuleoOutStandWarnAlarms.description: This object identifies the number of outstanding warnings and alarms for this module. If this value is not zero then user intervention is needed to resolve the outstanding warnings and alarms

mcrModuleDiagStatus.name: mcrModuleDiagStatus
mcrModuleDiagStatus.description: This object identifies the module's self-test diagnostics result. It will return zero if it passed and non-zero error code if the module has failed.The following are possible non-zero error codes: 1 - Media converter module's PHY is not functional. 2 - Firmware download required

mcrModuleTypeInserted.name: mcrModuleTypeInserted
mcrModuleTypeInserted.description: This object identifies the module type inserted for this chassis slot.

mcrMediaConfigBackupRestore.name: mcrMediaConfigBackupRestore
mcrMediaConfigBackupRestore.description: This object is applicable to media converter modules only. It identifies whether the media configuration will be automatically backed up to or restored from the management card's non-volatile memory

mcrMediaBackedupModuleType.name: mcrMediaBackedupModuleType
mcrMediaBackedupModuleType.description: This object identifies the media converter module type of the configuration that was backed up for the slot on the management card's non-volatile memory when the mcrMediaConfigBackupRestore object was enabled.

mcrChassisPwrUpSlotPwrState.name: mcrChassisPwrUpSlotPwrState
mcrChassisPwrUpSlotPwrState.description: This object identifies the default power state of the slot when the chassis is initially powered up. The current power state of the slot can be manually changed by writing to mcrCurrentPowerState object or dynamically changed via slot power schedule configuration. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

mcrCurrentPowerState.name: mcrCurrentPowerState
mcrCurrentPowerState.description: Writing this object allows the current power state of the slot to be turned on or off. This object is not writable for management modules or the 2-slot chassis. Reading this object will return the current slot power state.

mcrPowerScheduleEnable.name: mcrPowerScheduleEnable
mcrPowerScheduleEnable.description: This object is not applicable to management modules. It identifies if power schedule is enabled for the slot. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

mcrModuleReset.name: mcrModuleReset
mcrModuleReset.description: This object allows you to reset the module inserted in the slot.

mcrModuleResetToFactory.name: mcrModuleResetToFactory
mcrModuleResetToFactory.description: This object allows you to reset to factory the module inserted in the slot.

mcrModuleModelDesc.name: mcrModuleModelDesc
mcrModuleModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the slot.

cm1000FixedTable.name: cm1000FixedTable
cm1000FixedTable.description: Table of CM-1000 type media converter module's status type information.

cm1000FixedEntry.name: cm1000FixedEntry
cm1000FixedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1000 type media converter module.

cm1000SlotIndex.name: cm1000SlotIndex
cm1000SlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1000 type module is currently inserted

cm1000Modelname.name: cm1000Modelname
cm1000Modelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm1000ModelDesc.name: cm1000ModelDesc
cm1000ModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm1000HwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm1000HwJmp5ConfigMode
cm1000HwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware jumper J5 on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media converter module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm1000HwSw1FiberAutoNeg.name: cm1000HwSw1FiberAutoNeg
cm1000HwSw1FiberAutoNeg.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for fiber Auto-Negotiation.

cm1000HwSw2LinkMode.name: cm1000HwSw2LinkMode
cm1000HwSw2LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode.

cm1000HwSw3FiberFaultAlert.name: cm1000HwSw3FiberFaultAlert
cm1000HwSw3FiberFaultAlert.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Fiber Fault Alert.

cm1000HwSw4Duplex.name: cm1000HwSw4Duplex
cm1000HwSw4Duplex.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for copper duplex.

cm1000HwSw5Pause.name: cm1000HwSw5Pause
cm1000HwSw5Pause.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for copper pause (flow control).

cm1000HwSw6Loopback.name: cm1000HwSw6Loopback
cm1000HwSw6Loopback.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for fiber loopback mode.

cm1000FiberLinkStatus.name: cm1000FiberLinkStatus
cm1000FiberLinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status.

cm1000FiberConnType.name: cm1000FiberConnType
cm1000FiberConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type.

cm1000FiberAutoNegState.name: cm1000FiberAutoNegState
cm1000FiberAutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state.

cm1000FiberSpeed.name: cm1000FiberSpeed
cm1000FiberSpeed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second.

cm1000FiberDuplex.name: cm1000FiberDuplex
cm1000FiberDuplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm1000FiberPauseEnh.name: cm1000FiberPauseEnh
cm1000FiberPauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm1000FiberLPRFStatus.name: cm1000FiberLPRFStatus
cm1000FiberLPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's fiber Link Partner Remote Fault status.

cm1000FiberReceiveStatus.name: cm1000FiberReceiveStatus
cm1000FiberReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port

cm1000FiberLoopBack.name: cm1000FiberLoopBack
cm1000FiberLoopBack.description: Media converter module's current fiber loopback mode setting. Writing to this object will change the current settings. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000CopperLinkStatus.name: cm1000CopperLinkStatus
cm1000CopperLinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current copper link status.

cm1000CopperConnType.name: cm1000CopperConnType
cm1000CopperConnType.description: Media converter module's copper connector type.

cm1000CopperAutoNegState.name: cm1000CopperAutoNegState
cm1000CopperAutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current copper auto-negotiation state.

cm1000CopperSpeed.name: cm1000CopperSpeed
cm1000CopperSpeed.description: Media converter module's copper port speed in megabits per second.

cm1000CopperDuplex.name: cm1000CopperDuplex
cm1000CopperDuplex.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm1000CopperCrossOver.name: cm1000CopperCrossOver
cm1000CopperCrossOver.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated MDI/MDI-X setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm1000CopperPauseEnh.name: cm1000CopperPauseEnh
cm1000CopperPauseEnh.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm1000CopperLPRFStatus.name: cm1000CopperLPRFStatus
cm1000CopperLPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's copper Link Partner Remote Fault status.

cm1000ConfigTable.name: cm1000ConfigTable
cm1000ConfigTable.description: Table of CM-1000 type media converter module's configuration type information.

cm1000ConfigEntry.name: cm1000ConfigEntry
cm1000ConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1000 type media converter module.

cm1000ConfigSlotIndex.name: cm1000ConfigSlotIndex
cm1000ConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1000 type module is currently inserted

cm1000ConfigStatus.name: cm1000ConfigStatus
cm1000ConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm1000ConfigModuleName.name: cm1000ConfigModuleName
cm1000ConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm1000ConfigLinkMode.name: cm1000ConfigLinkMode
cm1000ConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000ConfigFiberFaultAlert.name: cm1000ConfigFiberFaultAlert
cm1000ConfigFiberFaultAlert.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000ConfigJumboPackets.name: cm1000ConfigJumboPackets
cm1000ConfigJumboPackets.description: This object identifies the Jumbo Packet setting for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm1000ConfigFiberPortName.name: cm1000ConfigFiberPortName
cm1000ConfigFiberPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the fiber port.

cm1000ConfigFiberPortEnable.name: cm1000ConfigFiberPortEnable
cm1000ConfigFiberPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the fiber port is enabled.

cm1000ConfigFiberAutoNeg.name: cm1000ConfigFiberAutoNeg
cm1000ConfigFiberAutoNeg.description: This object identifies the wither fiber auto-negotiation is enabled. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000ConfigCopperPortName.name: cm1000ConfigCopperPortName
cm1000ConfigCopperPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the copper port.

cm1000ConfigCopperPortEnable.name: cm1000ConfigCopperPortEnable
cm1000ConfigCopperPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the fiber port is enabled.

cm1000ConfigCopperDuplex.name: cm1000ConfigCopperDuplex
cm1000ConfigCopperDuplex.description: This object identifies the duplex settings for the copper port. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000ConfigCopperPauseEnh.name: cm1000ConfigCopperPauseEnh
cm1000ConfigCopperPauseEnh.description: This object identifies the copper pause (flow control) setting that is a advertised. The settings can be disabled, advertise symmetrical, advertise asymmetrical TX or advertise symmetrical and asymmetrical RX. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000ConfigCopperLowPower.name: cm1000ConfigCopperLowPower
cm1000ConfigCopperLowPower.description: This object identifies the copper low power setting for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm1000LedTable.name: cm1000LedTable
cm1000LedTable.description: Table of CM-1000 type media converter module's LED status information.

cm1000LedEntry.name: cm1000LedEntry
cm1000LedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1000 type media converter module.

cm1000LedSlotIndex.name: cm1000LedSlotIndex
cm1000LedSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1000 type module is currently inserted

cm1000LedPWR.name: cm1000LedPWR
cm1000LedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Fiber loopback enabled

cm1000LedLKF.name: cm1000LedLKF
cm1000LedLKF.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper (LKC) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No fiber link on(1) - Fiber link present

cm1000LedLKC.name: cm1000LedLKC
cm1000LedLKC.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper (LKC) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No copper link on(1) - Copper link present

cm1000mmFixedTable.name: cm1000mmFixedTable
cm1000mmFixedTable.description: Table of CM-1000MM type media converter module's status type information.

cm1000mmFixedEntry.name: cm1000mmFixedEntry
cm1000mmFixedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1000MM type media converter module.

cm1000mmSlotIndex.name: cm1000mmSlotIndex
cm1000mmSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1000MM type module is currently inserted

cm1000mmModelname.name: cm1000mmModelname
cm1000mmModelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm1000mmModelDesc.name: cm1000mmModelDesc
cm1000mmModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm1000mmHwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm1000mmHwJmp5ConfigMode
cm1000mmHwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware jumper J5 on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media converter module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm1000mmHwSw1FiberAutoNeg.name: cm1000mmHwSw1FiberAutoNeg
cm1000mmHwSw1FiberAutoNeg.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for fiber Auto-Negotiation.

cm1000mmHwSw2LinkMode.name: cm1000mmHwSw2LinkMode
cm1000mmHwSw2LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode.

cm1000mmHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.name: cm1000mmHwSw3FiberFaultAlert
cm1000mmHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Fiber Fault Alert.

cm1000mmHwSw4Loopback1.name: cm1000mmHwSw4Loopback1
cm1000mmHwSw4Loopback1.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for loopback (fiber port 1).

cm1000mmHwSw5Loopback2.name: cm1000mmHwSw5Loopback2
cm1000mmHwSw5Loopback2.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for loopback (fiber port 2).

cm1000mmFiber1LinkStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber1LinkStatus
cm1000mmFiber1LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 1).

cm1000mmFiber1ConnType.name: cm1000mmFiber1ConnType
cm1000mmFiber1ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 1).

cm1000mmFiber1AutoNegState.name: cm1000mmFiber1AutoNegState
cm1000mmFiber1AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 1).

cm1000mmFiber1Speed.name: cm1000mmFiber1Speed
cm1000mmFiber1Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 1).

cm1000mmFiber1Duplex.name: cm1000mmFiber1Duplex
cm1000mmFiber1Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm1000mmFiber1PauseEnh.name: cm1000mmFiber1PauseEnh
cm1000mmFiber1PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm1000mmFiber1LPRFStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber1LPRFStatus
cm1000mmFiber1LPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's fiber Link Partner Remote Fault status (port 1).

cm1000mmFiber1ReceiveStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber1ReceiveStatus
cm1000mmFiber1ReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port (port 1)

cm1000mmFiber2LinkStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber2LinkStatus
cm1000mmFiber2LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 2).

cm1000mmFiber2ConnType.name: cm1000mmFiber2ConnType
cm1000mmFiber2ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 2).

cm1000mmFiber2AutoNegState.name: cm1000mmFiber2AutoNegState
cm1000mmFiber2AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 2).

cm1000mmFiber2Speed.name: cm1000mmFiber2Speed
cm1000mmFiber2Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 2).

cm1000mmFiber2Duplex.name: cm1000mmFiber2Duplex
cm1000mmFiber2Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm1000mmFiber2PauseEnh.name: cm1000mmFiber2PauseEnh
cm1000mmFiber2PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm1000mmFiber2LPRFStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber2LPRFStatus
cm1000mmFiber2LPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's fiber Link Partner Remote Fault status (port 2).

cm1000mmFiber2ReceiveStatus.name: cm1000mmFiber2ReceiveStatus
cm1000mmFiber2ReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port (port 2)

cm1000mmFiberLoopBack.name: cm1000mmFiberLoopBack
cm1000mmFiberLoopBack.description: Media converter module's current fiber loopback mode setting. Writing to this object will change the current settings. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000mmConfigTable.name: cm1000mmConfigTable
cm1000mmConfigTable.description: Table of CM-1000MM type media converter module's configuration type information.

cm1000mmConfigEntry.name: cm1000mmConfigEntry
cm1000mmConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1000MM type media converter module.

cm1000mmConfigSlotIndex.name: cm1000mmConfigSlotIndex
cm1000mmConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1000MM type module is currently inserted

cm1000mmConfigStatus.name: cm1000mmConfigStatus
cm1000mmConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm1000mmConfigModuleName.name: cm1000mmConfigModuleName
cm1000mmConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm1000mmConfigLinkMode.name: cm1000mmConfigLinkMode
cm1000mmConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000mmConfigFiberFaultAlert.name: cm1000mmConfigFiberFaultAlert
cm1000mmConfigFiberFaultAlert.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1000mmConfigJumboPackets.name: cm1000mmConfigJumboPackets
cm1000mmConfigJumboPackets.description: This object identifies the Jumbo Packet setting for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm1000mmConfigFiberAutoNeg.name: cm1000mmConfigFiberAutoNeg
cm1000mmConfigFiberAutoNeg.description: This object identifies the wither fiber auto-negotiation is enabled for both ports. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm100ConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm1110ConfigFiberSfp100duplex.name: cm1110ConfigFiberSfp100duplex
cm1110ConfigFiberSfp100duplex.description: If the fiber connector type is SFP and it is a 100 Mbps fiber module then this object identifies the duplex setting for the 100 Mbps fiber port. Duplex for 1000 Mbps has to be auto negotiated. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1110ConfigCopperPortName.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPortName
cm1110ConfigCopperPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the copper port.

cm1110ConfigCopperPortEnable.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPortEnable
cm1110ConfigCopperPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the fiber port is enabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation.description: This object identifies the whether copper auto-negotiation is enabled. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv1000FDX.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv1000FDX
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv1000FDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 1000Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm1110ConfigCopperSpeed.name: cm1110ConfigCopperSpeed
cm1110ConfigCopperSpeed.description: If copper auto-negotiation is disabled then this object identifies the configured cooper speed. 1000 Mbps speed can only be auto negotiated. If copper auto-negotiation is enabled then this object is ignored. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1110ConfigCopperDuplex.name: cm1110ConfigCopperDuplex
cm1110ConfigCopperDuplex.description: If copper auto-negotiation is disabled then this object identifies the duplex setting for 10 & 100 Mbps for the copper port. Duplex for 1000 Mbps has to be auto negotiated. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1110ConfigCopperCrossOver.name: cm1110ConfigCopperCrossOver
cm1110ConfigCopperCrossOver.description: This object identifies the copper MDI/MDI-X setting.This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to

cm1110ConfigCopperPauseEnh.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPauseEnh
cm1110ConfigCopperPauseEnh.description: This object identifies the copper pause (flow control) setting that is a advertised. The settings can be disabled, advertise symmetrical, advertise asymmetrical TX or advertise symmetrical and asymmetrical RX. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm1110ConfigCopperAutoSpeedDownshift.name: cm1110ConfigCopperAutoSpeedDownshift
cm1110ConfigCopperAutoSpeedDownshift.description: This object identifies the number of times the PHY attempts to establish a Gigabit link before the PHY downshift to the next highest speed. A value of 0 indicates the auto downshift is disabled

cm1110ConfigCopper10BaseTDistance.name: cm1110ConfigCopper10BaseTDistance
cm1110ConfigCopper10BaseTDistance.description: When using cable exceeding 100 meters in 10BASE-T mode this feature should be set to extended(1).

cm1110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.name: cm1110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet
cm1110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.description: Restrict the flow of Ethernet traffic to a single direction. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 1. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 2. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 3. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 4. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 5. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7.name: cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7
cm1110ConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopper8021pPriority.name: cm1110ConfigCopper8021pPriority
cm1110ConfigCopper8021pPriority.description: Use 802.1p tag priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperIpTosPriority.name: cm1110ConfigCopperIpTosPriority
cm1110ConfigCopperIpTosPriority.description: Use IP TOS priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityPrecedence.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityPrecedence
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityPrecedence.description: Configure priority precedence. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperCongestionPolicy.name: cm1110ConfigCopperCongestionPolicy
cm1110ConfigCopperCongestionPolicy.description: Configure priority congestion policy. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap0.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap0
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap0.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap1.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap1
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap1.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 1. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap2.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap2
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap2.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 2. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap3.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap3
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap3.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 3. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap4.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 4. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap5.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap5
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap5.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 5. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap6.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap6
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap6.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap7.name: cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap7
cm1110ConfigCopperPriorityMap7.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperIngressLimit.name: cm1110ConfigCopperIngressLimit
cm1110ConfigCopperIngressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of incoming packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperEgressLimit.name: cm1110ConfigCopperEgressLimit
cm1110ConfigCopperEgressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of outgoing packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardTaggedFrames.name: cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardTaggedFrames
cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardTaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of tagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardUntaggedFrames.name: cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardUntaggedFrames
cm1110ConfigCopperDiscardUntaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of untagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultVlanId.name: cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultVlanId
cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultVlanId.description: Set the default VLAN ID to insert when tagging frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultPriority.name: cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultPriority
cm1110ConfigCopperDefaultPriority.description: Set the default frame priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperVlanTaggingAction.name: cm1110ConfigCopperVlanTaggingAction
cm1110ConfigCopperVlanTaggingAction.description: Set the default tagging action. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownMulticast.name: cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownMulticast
cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownMulticast.description: Enable filtering of multicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownUnicast.name: cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownUnicast
cm1110ConfigCopperFilterUnknownUnicast.description: Enable filtering of unicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiber8021pPriority.name: cm1110ConfigFiber8021pPriority
cm1110ConfigFiber8021pPriority.description: Use 802.1p tag priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberIpTosPriority.name: cm1110ConfigFiberIpTosPriority
cm1110ConfigFiberIpTosPriority.description: Use IP TOS priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityPrecedence.name: cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityPrecedence

cm1110ConfigFiberCongestionPolicy.name: cm1110ConfigFiberCongestionPolicy
cm1110ConfigFiberCongestionPolicy.description: Configure priority congestion policy. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap0.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap6.name: cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap6
cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap6.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap7.name: cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap7
cm1110ConfigFiberPriorityMap7.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberIngressLimit.name: cm1110ConfigFiberIngressLimit
cm1110ConfigFiberIngressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of incoming packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberEgressLimit.name: cm1110ConfigFiberEgressLimit
cm1110ConfigFiberEgressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of outgoing packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardTaggedFrames.name: cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardTaggedFrames
cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardTaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of tagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardUntaggedFrames.name: cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardUntaggedFrames
cm1110ConfigFiberDiscardUntaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of untagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultVlanId.name: cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultVlanId
cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultVlanId.description: Set the default VLAN ID to insert when tagging frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultPriority.name: cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultPriority
cm1110ConfigFiberDefaultPriority.description: Set the default frame priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberVlanTaggingAction.name: cm1110ConfigFiberVlanTaggingAction
cm1110ConfigFiberVlanTaggingAction.description: Set the default tagging action. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownMulticast.name: cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownMulticast
cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownMulticast.description: Enable filtering of multicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownUnicast.name: cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownUnicast
cm1110ConfigFiberFilterUnknownUnicast.description: Enable filtering of unicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

cm1110ConfigFiberSgmiiInterface.name: cm1110ConfigFiberSgmiiInterface
cm1110ConfigFiberSgmiiInterface.description: This object identifies whether fiber SGMII interface is enabled.

cm1110LedTable.name: cm1110LedTable
cm1110LedTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's LED status information.

cm1110LedEntry.name: cm1110LedEntry
cm1110LedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

cm1110LedSlotIndex.name: cm1110LedSlotIndex
cm1110LedSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1110 type module is currently inserted

cm1110LedPWR.name: cm1110LedPWR
cm1110LedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Fiber loopback enabled

cm1110LedFDF.name: cm1110LedFDF
cm1110LedFDF.description: This object identifies the status of the Full Duplex Fiber (FDF) LED on the media converter module.

cm1110LedLKF.name: cm1110LedLKF
cm1110LedLKF.description: This object identifies the status of the link fiber (LKF) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No fiber link on(1) - Fiber link present

cm1110LedCopperSpeed.name: cm1110LedCopperSpeed
cm1110LedCopperSpeed.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper speed (100/1000) LED on the management module.

cm1110LedFDC.name: cm1110LedFDC
cm1110LedFDC.description: This object identifies the status of the Full Duplex Copper (FDC) LED on the media converter module.

cm1110LedLKC.name: cm1110LedLKC
cm1110LedLKC.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper (LKC) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No copper link on(1) - Copper link present

cm1110RateConvStatsTable.name: cm1110RateConvStatsTable
cm1110RateConvStatsTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's configuration and status type information.

cm1110RateConvStatsEntry.name: cm1110RateConvStatsEntry
cm1110RateConvStatsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

cm1110StatsSlotIndex.name: cm1110StatsSlotIndex
cm1110StatsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1110 type module is currently inserted

cm1110MediaPortIndex.name: cm1110MediaPortIndex
cm1110MediaPortIndex.description: Media converter module port index indicating which media port the statistical counters are associated with.

cm1110PortInDiscards.name: cm1110PortInDiscards
cm1110PortInDiscards.description: A counter that counts the number of good, non-filtered frames that normally would have been forwarded, but could not due to lack of buffer space.

cm1110PortInFiltered.name: cm1110PortInFiltered
cm1110PortInFiltered.description: A counter that counts the number of good frames that were filtered due to ingress switch policy rules.

cm1110PortInGoodOctets.name: cm1110PortInGoodOctets
cm1110PortInGoodOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames received on the media port.

cm1110PortHCInGoodOctets.name: cm1110PortHCInGoodOctets
cm1110PortHCInGoodOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames received on the media port. This object is a 64-bit version of cm1110PortInGoodOctets.

cm1110PortInBadOctets.name: cm1110PortInBadOctets
cm1110PortInBadOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all bad Ethernet frames received on the media port..

cm1110PortInUnicasts.name: cm1110PortInUnicasts
cm1110PortInUnicasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

cm1110PortInBroadcasts.name: cm1110PortInBroadcasts
cm1110PortInBroadcasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

cm1110PortInMulticasts.name: cm1110PortInMulticasts
cm1110PortInMulticasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the cm1110PortInPauses or the cm1110PortInBroadcasts objects.

cm1110PortInPauses.name: cm1110PortInPauses
cm1110PortInPauses.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames reachieved that have a Pause destination MAC address.

cm1110PortInUnderSizes.name: cm1110PortInUnderSizes
cm1110PortInUnderSizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets but with a valid FCS.

cm1110PortInFragments.name: cm1110PortInFragments
cm1110PortInFragments.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets and an invalid FCS.

cm1110PortInOversizes.name: cm1110PortInOversizes
cm1110PortInOversizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a valid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm1110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm1110PortInJabbers.name: cm1110PortInJabbers
cm1110PortInJabbers.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a invalid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm1110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm1110PortInRxErrs.name: cm1110PortInRxErrs
cm1110PortInRxErrs.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with an RxErr signal from the PHY.

cm1110PortInFcsErrs.name: cm1110PortInFcsErrs
cm1110PortInFcsErrs.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a CRC error not counted in the cm1110PortInFragments, cm1110PortInFcsErr, or the cm1110PortInRxErr objects.

cm1110PortPkts64Octets.name: cm1110PortPkts64Octets
cm1110PortPkts64Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of exactly 64 Octets, including those with errors.

cm1110PortPkts65to127Octets.name: cm1110PortPkts65to127Octets
cm1110PortPkts65to127Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 65 and 127 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm1110PortPkts128to255Octets.name: cm1110PortPkts128to255Octets
cm1110PortPkts128to255Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 128 and 255 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm1110PortPkts256to511Octets.name: cm1110PortPkts256to511Octets
cm1110PortPkts256to511Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 256 and 511 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm1110PortPkts512to1023Octets.name: cm1110PortPkts512to1023Octets
cm1110PortPkts512to1023Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 512 and 1023 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm1110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets.name: cm1110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets
cm1110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 1024 and maximum packet size octets inclusive, including those with errors. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm1110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm1110PortOutOctets.name: cm1110PortOutOctets
cm1110PortOutOctets.description: An Egress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames sent on the media port.

cm1110PortHCOutOctets.name: cm1110PortHCOutOctets
cm1110PortHCOutOctets.description: An Egress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames sent on the media port. This object is a 64-bit version of cm1110PortOutOctets.

cm1110PortOutFiltered.name: cm1110PortOutFiltered
cm1110PortOutFiltered.description: A counter that counts the number of good frames that were filtered due to egress switch policy rules.

cm1110PortOutUnicasts.name: cm1110PortOutUnicasts
cm1110PortOutUnicasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

cm1110PortOutBroadcasts.name: cm1110PortOutBroadcasts
cm1110PortOutBroadcasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

cm1110PortOutMulticasts.name: cm1110PortOutMulticasts
cm1110PortOutMulticasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the cm1110PortOutPauses or the cm1110PortOutBroadcasts objects.

cm1110PortOutPauses.name: cm1110PortOutPauses
cm1110PortOutPauses.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames reachieved that have a Pause destination MAC address.

cm1110PortDeferreds.name: cm1110PortDeferreds
cm1110PortDeferreds.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced no collisions but are delayed because the medium was busy during the first attempt. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortCollisions.name: cm1110PortCollisions
cm1110PortCollisions.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of collision events seen by the MAC not including those counted in cm1110PortSingles, cm1110PortMultiple , cm1110PortExcessives or cm1110PortLates objects. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortSingles.name: cm1110PortSingles
cm1110PortSingles.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced exactly one collision. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortMultiples.name: cm1110PortMultiples
cm1110PortMultiples.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced more than one collision. This counter is aplicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortExcessives.name: cm1110PortExcessives
cm1110PortExcessives.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames dropped in the transmit MAC because the frame experienced 16 consecutive collisions. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortLates.name: cm1110PortLates
cm1110PortLates.description: An Egress counter that counts the number times a collision is detected later than 512 bits-times into the transmission of a frame. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm1110PortOutFcsErrs.name: cm1110PortOutFcsErrs
cm1110PortOutFcsErrs.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames transmitted with an invalid FCS.

cm1110PortResetCounters.name: cm1110PortResetCounters
cm1110PortResetCounters.description: Allows the resetting of all cm1110RateConvStats statistical counters for this port.

cm1110RateConvAvctTable.name: cm1110RateConvAvctTable
cm1110RateConvAvctTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's

cm1110RateConvAvctEntry.name: cm1110RateConvAvctEntry
cm1110RateConvAvctEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate fiber or copper port on the CM-1110 type media converter module.

cm1110AvctSlotIndex.name: cm1110AvctSlotIndex
cm1110AvctSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1110 type module is currently inserted

cm1110AvctStart.name: cm1110AvctStart
cm1110AvctStart.description: Set this self-clearing variable to yes initiate the Advanced Virtual Cable Test. Note: During the test, no network data will be passed.

cm1110AvctStatus.name: cm1110AvctStatus
cm1110AvctStatus.description: This object identifies the state of the Advanced Virtual Cable Tester.

cm110Modelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm110ModelDesc.name: cm110ModelDesc
cm110ModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm110HwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm110HwJmp5ConfigMode
cm110HwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware switch on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm110HwJmp6AutoMDIX.name: cm110HwJmp6AutoMDIX
cm110HwJmp6AutoMDIX.description: This object identifies the media converter module's hardware Auto MDIX jumper settings.

cm110HwSw1TpAutoNegotiation.name: cm110HwSw1TpAutoNegotiation
cm110HwSw1TpAutoNegotiation.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for copper auto-negotiation.

cm110HwSw2LinkMode.name: cm110HwSw2LinkMode
cm110HwSw2LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode.

cm110HwSw3FarEndFault.name: cm110HwSw3FarEndFault
cm110HwSw3FarEndFault.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Far End Fault.

cm110HwSw4TpDuplex.name: cm110HwSw4TpDuplex
cm110HwSw4TpDuplex.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for copper duplex.

cm110HwSw5TpSpeed.name: cm110HwSw5TpSpeed
cm110HwSw5TpSpeed.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode.

cm110HwSw6FiberDuplex.name: cm110HwSw6FiberDuplex
cm110HwSw6FiberDuplex.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for fiber duplex.

cm110HwSw7Loopback.name: cm110HwSw7Loopback
cm110HwSw7Loopback.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for fiber loopback mode.

cm110FiberLinkStatus.name: cm110FiberLinkStatus
cm110FiberLinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status.

cm110FiberConnType.name: cm110FiberConnType
cm110FiberConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type.

cm110FiberSpeed.name: cm110FiberSpeed
cm110FiberSpeed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second.

cm110FiberFarEndFault.name: cm110FiberFarEndFault
cm110FiberFarEndFault.description: Media converter module's current fiber Far End Fault status.

cm110FiberReceiveStatus.name: cm110FiberReceiveStatus
cm110FiberReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port

cm110FiberLoopBack.name: cm110FiberLoopBack
cm110FiberLoopBack.description: This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110CopperLinkStatus.name: cm110CopperLinkStatus
cm110CopperLinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current copper link status.

cm110CopperConnType.name: cm110CopperConnType
cm110CopperConnType.description: Media converter module's copper connector type.

cm110CopperAutoNegState.name: cm110CopperAutoNegState
cm110CopperAutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current copper auto-negotiation state.

cm110CopperSpeed.name: cm110CopperSpeed
cm110CopperSpeed.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated speed setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm110CopperDuplex.name: cm110CopperDuplex
cm110CopperDuplex.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm110CopperCrossOver.name: cm110CopperCrossOver
cm110CopperCrossOver.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated MDI/MDI-X setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm110CopperPause.name: cm110CopperPause
cm110CopperPause.description: If copper auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current copper auto-negotiated pause (flow control) setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

cm110CopperLPRFStatus.name: cm110CopperLPRFStatus
cm110CopperLPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's fiber Link Partner Remote Fault status.

cm110ConfigTable.name: cm110ConfigTable
cm110ConfigTable.description: Table of CM-110 type media converter module's configuration and status type information.

cm110ConfigEntry.name: cm110ConfigEntry
cm110ConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-110 type media converter module.

cm110ConfigSlotIndex.name: cm110ConfigSlotIndex
cm110ConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-110 type module is currently inserted

cm110ConfigStatus.name: cm110ConfigStatus
cm110ConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm110ConfigModuleName.name: cm110ConfigModuleName
cm110ConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm110ConfigLinkMode.name: cm110ConfigLinkMode
cm110ConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigFiberFarEndFault.name: cm110ConfigFiberFarEndFault
cm110ConfigFiberFarEndFault.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This setting is always enabled if Link Mode is set to linkPassthrough. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigMaxPacketSize.name: cm110ConfigMaxPacketSize
cm110ConfigMaxPacketSize.description: This object identifies the media converter module's maximum packet size setting This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigFiberPortName.name: cm110ConfigFiberPortName
cm110ConfigFiberPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the fiber port.

cm110ConfigFiberPortEnable.name: cm110ConfigFiberPortEnable
cm110ConfigFiberPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the fiber port is enabled.

cm110ConfigFiberDuplex.name: cm110ConfigFiberDuplex
cm110ConfigFiberDuplex.description: This object identifies the fiber port duplex setting.

cm110ConfigCopperPortName.name: cm110ConfigCopperPortName
cm110ConfigCopperPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the copper port.

cm110ConfigCopperPortEnable.name: cm110ConfigCopperPortEnable
cm110ConfigCopperPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the fiber port is enabled.

cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation.name: cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation
cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegotiation.description: This object identifies the whether copper auto-negotiation is enabled. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX.name: cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX
cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10HDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX.name: cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX
cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv10FDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX.name: cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX
cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100HDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX.name: cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX
cm110ConfigCopperAutoNegAdv100FDX.description: This object controls whether or the copper port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

cm110ConfigCopperSpeed.name: cm110ConfigCopperSpeed
cm110ConfigCopperSpeed.description: This object identifies the current copper speed in megabits per second. This object is ignored if auto-negotiation is enabled. This object is ignored if auto-negotiation is enabled

cm110ConfigCopperDuplex.name: cm110ConfigCopperDuplex
cm110ConfigCopperDuplex.description: This object identifies the copper duplex setting. This object is ignored if auto-negotiation is enabled This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigCopperCrossOver.name: cm110ConfigCopperCrossOver
cm110ConfigCopperCrossOver.description: This object identifies the copper MDI/MDI-X setting.This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to

cm110ConfigCopperPause.name: cm110ConfigCopperPause
cm110ConfigCopperPause.description: This object identifies the copper's pause (flow control) settings. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm110ConfigCopperExtendDistance.name: cm110ConfigCopperExtendDistance
cm110ConfigCopperExtendDistance.description: When using cable exceeding 100 meters, the 10BASE-T this feature should be enabled.

cm110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.name: cm110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet
cm110ConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.description: Restrict the flow of Ethernet traffic to a single direction. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).
