cm110LedTable.name: cm110LedTable
cm110LedTable.description: Table of CM-110 type media converter module's LED status information.

cm110LedEntry.name: cm110LedEntry
cm110LedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-110 type media converter module.

cm110LedSlotIndex.name: cm110LedSlotIndex
cm110LedSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-110 type module is currently inserted

cm110LedPWR.name: cm110LedPWR
cm110LedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Fiber loopback enabled

cm110LedFDF.name: cm110LedFDF
cm110LedFDF.description: This object identifies the status of the Full Duplex Fiber (FDF) LED on the media converter module.

cm110LedLKF.name: cm110LedLKF
cm110LedLKF.description: This object identifies the status of the link fiber (LKF) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No fiber link on(1) - Fiber link present

cm110LedCopperSpeed.name: cm110LedCopperSpeed
cm110LedCopperSpeed.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper speed (100/1000) LED on the media converter module.

cm110LedFDC.name: cm110LedFDC
cm110LedFDC.description: This object identifies the status of the Full Duplex Copper (FDC) LED on the media converter module.

cm110LedLKC.name: cm110LedLKC
cm110LedLKC.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper (LKC) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No copper link on(1) - Copper link present

cm110RateConvStatsTable.name: cm110RateConvStatsTable
cm110RateConvStatsTable.description: Table of CM-110 media converter module's configuration and status type information.

cm110RateConvStatsEntry.name: cm110RateConvStatsEntry
cm110RateConvStatsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-110 type media converter module.

cm110StatsSlotIndex.name: cm110StatsSlotIndex
cm110StatsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-110 type module is currently inserted

cm110MediaPortIndex.name: cm110MediaPortIndex
cm110MediaPortIndex.description: Media converter module port index indicating which media port the statistical counters are associated with.

cm110PortRxErrors.name: cm110PortRxErrors
cm110PortRxErrors.description: Total number of bad frames received.

cm110PortTxCollisions.name: cm110PortTxCollisions
cm110PortTxCollisions.description: Total number of TX collisions encountered.

cm110PortInFiltered.name: cm110PortInFiltered
cm110PortInFiltered.description: A counter that counts the number of good frames that were filtered due to ingress switch policy rules.

cm110PortInGoodOctets.name: cm110PortInGoodOctets
cm110PortInGoodOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames received on the media port.

cm110PortInBadOctets.name: cm110PortInBadOctets
cm110PortInBadOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all bad Ethernet frames received on the media port..

cm110PortInUnicasts.name: cm110PortInUnicasts
cm110PortInUnicasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

cm110PortInBroadcasts.name: cm110PortInBroadcasts
cm110PortInBroadcasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

cm110PortInMulticasts.name: cm110PortInMulticasts
cm110PortInMulticasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the cm1110PortInPauses or the cm1110PortInBroadcasts objects.

cm110PortInPauses.name: cm110PortInPauses
cm110PortInPauses.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Pause destination MAC address.

cm110PortInUnderSizes.name: cm110PortInUnderSizes
cm110PortInUnderSizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets but with a valid FCS.

cm110PortInFragments.name: cm110PortInFragments
cm110PortInFragments.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets and an invalid FCS.

cm110PortInOversizes.name: cm110PortInOversizes
cm110PortInOversizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a valid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm110PortInJabbers.name: cm110PortInJabbers
cm110PortInJabbers.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a invalid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm110PortInMACRcvErrs.name: cm110PortInMACRcvErrs
cm110PortInMACRcvErrs.description: An ingress counter of the number of Rx errors on the receive side of the MAC

cm110PortInFcsErrs.name: cm110PortInFcsErrs
cm110PortInFcsErrs.description: An ingress counter of the number of FCS Errors.

cm110PortPkts64Octets.name: cm110PortPkts64Octets
cm110PortPkts64Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of exactly 64 Octets, including those with errors.

cm110PortPkts65to127Octets.name: cm110PortPkts65to127Octets
cm110PortPkts65to127Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 65 and 127 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm110PortPkts128to255Octets.name: cm110PortPkts128to255Octets
cm110PortPkts128to255Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 128 and 255 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm110PortPkts256to511Octets.name: cm110PortPkts256to511Octets
cm110PortPkts256to511Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 256 and 511 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm110PortPkts512to1023Octets.name: cm110PortPkts512to1023Octets
cm110PortPkts512to1023Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 512 and 1023 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

cm110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets.name: cm110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets
cm110PortPkts1024toMaxOctets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 1024 and maximum packet size octets inclusive, including those with errors. The maximum packet size can be set using the cm1110ConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

cm110PortOutOctets.name: cm110PortOutOctets
cm110PortOutOctets.description: An Egress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames sent on the media port.

cm110PortOutUnicasts.name: cm110PortOutUnicasts
cm110PortOutUnicasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

cm110PortOutBroadcasts.name: cm110PortOutBroadcasts
cm110PortOutBroadcasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

cm110PortOutMulticasts.name: cm110PortOutMulticasts
cm110PortOutMulticasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the cm1110PortOutPauses or the cm1110PortOutBroadcasts objects.

cm110PortOutPauses.name: cm110PortOutPauses
cm110PortOutPauses.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Pause destination MAC address.

cm110PortDeferreds.name: cm110PortDeferreds
cm110PortDeferreds.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced no collsions but are delayed because the medium was busy during the first attempt. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortCollisions.name: cm110PortCollisions
cm110PortCollisions.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of collision events seen by the MAC not including those counted in cm110PortSingles, cm110PortMultiple , cm1110PortExcessives or cm110PortLates objects. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortSingles.name: cm110PortSingles
cm110PortSingles.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced exactly one collision. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortMultiples.name: cm110PortMultiples
cm110PortMultiples.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced more than one collision. This counter is aplicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortExcessives.name: cm110PortExcessives
cm110PortExcessives.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames dropped in the transmit MAC because the frame experienced 16 consecutive collisions. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortLates.name: cm110PortLates
cm110PortLates.description: An Egress counter that counts the number times a collision is detected later than 512 bits-times into the transmission of a frame. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

cm110PortOutFcsErrs.name: cm110PortOutFcsErrs
cm110PortOutFcsErrs.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames transmitted with an invalid FCS.

cm110PortResetCounters.name: cm110PortResetCounters
cm110PortResetCounters.description: Allows the resetting of all cm110RateConvStats statistical counters for this port.

cm110RateConvVctTable.name: cm110RateConvVctTable
cm110RateConvVctTable.description: Table of CM-110 type media converter module's

cm110RateConvVctEntry.name: cm110RateConvVctEntry
cm110RateConvVctEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate fiber or copper port on the CM-110 type media converter module.

cm110VctSlotIndex.name: cm110VctSlotIndex
cm110VctSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-1110 type module is currently inserted

cm110VctStart.name: cm110VctStart
cm110VctStart.description: Set this self-clearing variable to yes initiate the Advanced Virtual Cable Test. Note: During the test, no network data will be passed.

cm110VctStatus.name: cm110VctStatus
cm110VctStatus.description: This object identifies the stat of the Advanced Virtual Cable Test.

cm110VctTxPairResults.name: cm110VctTxPairResults
cm110VctTxPairResults.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of the Tx pair.

cm110VctTxPairAmplitude.name: cm110VctTxPairAmplitude
cm110VctTxPairAmplitude.description: Amplitude of Tx pair in Volts.

cm110VctTxPairDistance.name: cm110VctTxPairDistance
cm110VctTxPairDistance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes is short or open.

cm110VctRxPairResults.name: cm110VctRxPairResults
cm110VctRxPairResults.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of the Rx pair.

cm110VctRxPairAmplitude.name: cm110VctRxPairAmplitude
cm110VctRxPairAmplitude.description: Amplitude of Rx pair in Volts.

cm110VctRxPairDistance.name: cm110VctRxPairDistance
cm110VctRxPairDistance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes is short or open.

mcrMgtTable.name: mcrMgtTable
mcrMgtTable.description: Table of MCR-MGT management module status type information.

mcrMgtEntry.name: mcrMgtEntry
mcrMgtEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate MCR-MGT type management module.

mcrMgtSlotIndex.name: mcrMgtSlotIndex
mcrMgtSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the MCR-MGT module is currently inserted

mcrMgtModelName.name: mcrMgtModelName
mcrMgtModelName.description: This object identifies the model name of management module present in the chassis

mcrMgtModelDesc.name: mcrMgtModelDesc
mcrMgtModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the management module present in the chassis

mcrMgtFailSafeBootLoaderVer.name: mcrMgtFailSafeBootLoaderVer
mcrMgtFailSafeBootLoaderVer.description: This object identifies the fail-safe bootloader version of the management module present in the chassis

mcrMgtUpTime.name: mcrMgtUpTime
mcrMgtUpTime.description: This object identifies the time (in hundredths of a second) since the management module was last re-initialized.

mcrMgtConsoleDSR.name: mcrMgtConsoleDSR
mcrMgtConsoleDSR.description: This object identifies the current status of the DSR signal, (active or inactive)

mcrMgtConfigTable.name: mcrMgtConfigTable
mcrMgtConfigTable.description: Table of MCR-MGT management module Hardware configuration type information.

mcrMgtConfigEntry.name: mcrMgtConfigEntry
mcrMgtConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate MCR-MGT type management module.

mcrMgtConfigSlotIndex.name: mcrMgtConfigSlotIndex
mcrMgtConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the MCR-MGT module is currently inserted

mcrMgtConfigStatus.name: mcrMgtConfigStatus
mcrMgtConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

mcrMgtConfigEthSpeedDuplex.name: mcrMgtConfigEthSpeedDuplex
mcrMgtConfigEthSpeedDuplex.description: Define the Ethernet connection speed/duplex of the twisted pair interface.

mcrMgtConfigEthCrossover.name: mcrMgtConfigEthCrossover
mcrMgtConfigEthCrossover.description: Define the Ethernet connection crossover TX/RX Pair orientation of the twisted pair interface as auto(0), mdi(1) (straight through) or mdix(2) (crossed over).

mcrMgtConfigConsolePortEnabled.name: mcrMgtConfigConsolePortEnabled
mcrMgtConfigConsolePortEnabled.description: Determines whether the management module's console port is enabled.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleSpeed.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleSpeed
mcrMgtConfigConsoleSpeed.description: Specifies the baud rate of the console port; keep in mind that speed is affected by the length of the cable.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleDataBits.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleDataBits
mcrMgtConfigConsoleDataBits.description: Specifies the number of bits in a byte.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleParity.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleParity
mcrMgtConfigConsoleParity.description: Specifies if you are using Even, Odd, or No parity on the console.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleStopBits.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleStopBits
mcrMgtConfigConsoleStopBits.description: Specifies the number of stop bits that follow a byte.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleFlowControl.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleFlowControl
mcrMgtConfigConsoleFlowControl.description: Defines whether the data flow is handled by the software (Soft), hardware (Hard), both or None.

mcrMgtConfigConsoleMonitorDSR.name: mcrMgtConfigConsoleMonitorDSR
mcrMgtConfigConsoleMonitorDSR.description: Specifies whether the RS-232 signal DSR (Data Set Ready) should be monitored, for the console port. When DSR is monitored and the management module detects the DSR signal go inactive then the current console management session will be reset.

mcrMgtLedTable.name: mcrMgtLedTable
mcrMgtLedTable.description: Table of MCR-MGT management module LED information.

mcrMgtLedEntry.name: mcrMgtLedEntry
mcrMgtLedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate MCR-MGT type management module.

mcrMgtLedSlotIndex.name: mcrMgtLedSlotIndex
mcrMgtLedSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the MCR-MGT module is currently inserted

mcrMgtLedPWR.name: mcrMgtLedPWR
mcrMgtLedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the management module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module

mcrMgtLedALM.name: mcrMgtLedALM
mcrMgtLedALM.description: This object identifies the status of the alarm (ALM) LED on the management module. Possible status values are: offNoAlarms(0) - Normal operating condition onRedAlarmsPresent(1) - System hardware or software alarms present

mcrMgtLedLKC.name: mcrMgtLedLKC
mcrMgtLedLKC.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper (LKC) LED on the management module. Possible status values are: offLinkDown(0) - Copper link status is DOWN onGreenLinkUp(1) - Copper link status is UP

mcrMgtLedCopperSpeed.name: mcrMgtLedCopperSpeed
mcrMgtLedCopperSpeed.description: This object identifies the status of the link copper speed (100/1000) LED on the management module.

mcrMgtEthStatsTable.name: mcrMgtEthStatsTable
mcrMgtEthStatsTable.description: Table of MCR-MGT management module Ethernet status and statistics information.

mcrMgtEthStatsEntry.name: mcrMgtEthStatsEntry
mcrMgtEthStatsEntry.description: An entry in the Ethernet statistics table, each relating to an Ethernet interface.

mgtEthSlotIndex.name: mgtEthSlotIndex
mgtEthSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the MCR-MGT module is currently inserted.

mgtEthStatsStatus.name: mgtEthStatsStatus
mgtEthStatsStatus.description: Displays the Ethernet link status - down(0) or up(1).

mgtEthStatsSpeedDuplex.name: mgtEthStatsSpeedDuplex
mgtEthStatsSpeedDuplex.description: Current status of the Ethernet connection speed/duplex twisted pair interface. When the management module does not know the pair speed/duplex, this variable has the value unknown(0).

mgtEthStatsBroadcast.name: mgtEthStatsBroadcast
mgtEthStatsBroadcast.description: The management module's Ethernet Broadcast Flags status.

mgtEthStatsDebug.name: mgtEthStatsDebug
mgtEthStatsDebug.description: The management module's Ethernet Debug Flags status.

mgtEthStatsLoopback.name: mgtEthStatsLoopback
mgtEthStatsLoopback.description: The management module's Ethernet Loopback Flags status.

mgtEthStatsPointtoPoint.name: mgtEthStatsPointtoPoint
mgtEthStatsPointtoPoint.description: The management module's Ethernet Point to Point Flags status.

mgtEthStatsNoTrailers.name: mgtEthStatsNoTrailers
mgtEthStatsNoTrailers.description: The management module's Ethernet No Trailers Flags status.

mgtEthStatsRunning.name: mgtEthStatsRunning
mgtEthStatsRunning.description: The management module's Ethernet Running Flags status.

mgtEthStatsNoArp.name: mgtEthStatsNoArp
mgtEthStatsNoArp.description: The management module's Ethernet No Arp Protocol Flags status.

mgtEthStatsPromiscuous.name: mgtEthStatsPromiscuous
mgtEthStatsPromiscuous.description: The management module's Ethernet Promiscuous Flags status.

mgtEthStatsRxMulticast.name: mgtEthStatsRxMulticast
mgtEthStatsRxMulticast.description: The management module's Ethernet Receive all Multicast Flags status.

mgtEthStatsMasterLoadBalancer.name: mgtEthStatsMasterLoadBalancer
mgtEthStatsMasterLoadBalancer.description: The management module's Ethernet Master Load Balancer Flags status.

mgtEthStatsSlaveLoadBalancer.name: mgtEthStatsSlaveLoadBalancer
mgtEthStatsSlaveLoadBalancer.description: The management module's Ethernet Slave Load Balancer Flags status.

mgtEthStatsMulticast.name: mgtEthStatsMulticast
mgtEthStatsMulticast.description: The management module's Ethernet Multicast Flags status.

mgtEthStatsSetMedia.name: mgtEthStatsSetMedia
mgtEthStatsSetMedia.description: The management module's Ethernet Set Media Flags status.

mgtEthStatsAutoMedia.name: mgtEthStatsAutoMedia
mgtEthStatsAutoMedia.description: The management module's Ethernet Auto Media Flags status.

mgtEthStatsDynamic.name: mgtEthStatsDynamic
mgtEthStatsDynamic.description: The management module's Ethernet Dynamic Flags status.

mgtEthStatsLocalAddress.name: mgtEthStatsLocalAddress
mgtEthStatsLocalAddress.description: The management module's Ethernet local IPv4 address.

mgtEthStatsSubnetMask.name: mgtEthStatsSubnetMask
mgtEthStatsSubnetMask.description: The management module's Ethernet IPv4 subnet mask.

mgtEthStatsBroadcastAddress.name: mgtEthStatsBroadcastAddress
mgtEthStatsBroadcastAddress.description: The management module's Ethernet Broadcast address.

mgtEthStatsTxQLen.name: mgtEthStatsTxQLen
mgtEthStatsTxQLen.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Queue Length.

mgtEthStatsRxBytes.name: mgtEthStatsRxBytes
mgtEthStatsRxBytes.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Bytes count.

mgtEthStatsTxBytes.name: mgtEthStatsTxBytes
mgtEthStatsTxBytes.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Bytes count.

mgtEthStatsRxPackets.name: mgtEthStatsRxPackets
mgtEthStatsRxPackets.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Packets count.

mgtEthStatsTxPackets.name: mgtEthStatsTxPackets
mgtEthStatsTxPackets.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Packets count.

mgtEthStatsRxErrors.name: mgtEthStatsRxErrors
mgtEthStatsRxErrors.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Packets Errors count.

mgtEthStatsTxPktErrors.name: mgtEthStatsTxPktErrors
mgtEthStatsTxPktErrors.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Packets Errors count.

mgtEthStatsRxDroppedPkts.name: mgtEthStatsRxDroppedPkts
mgtEthStatsRxDroppedPkts.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Dropped packets count.

mgtEthStatsTxDroppedPkts.name: mgtEthStatsTxDroppedPkts
mgtEthStatsTxDroppedPkts.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Dropped packets count.

mgtEthStatsRxOverruns.name: mgtEthStatsRxOverruns
mgtEthStatsRxOverruns.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Overruns count

mgtEthStatsTxOverruns.name: mgtEthStatsTxOverruns
mgtEthStatsTxOverruns.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Overruns count.

mgtEthStatsRxFrameErrs.name: mgtEthStatsRxFrameErrs
mgtEthStatsRxFrameErrs.description: The management module's Ethernet RX Frame Errors count.

mgtEthStatsTxCarrierErrs.name: mgtEthStatsTxCarrierErrs
mgtEthStatsTxCarrierErrs.description: The management module's Ethernet TX Carrier Errors count

mgtEthStatsCollisions.name: mgtEthStatsCollisions
mgtEthStatsCollisions.description: The management module's Ethernet Collisions count.

cm10gFixedTable.name: cm10gFixedTable
cm10gFixedTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's status type information.

cm10gFixedEntry.name: cm10gFixedEntry
cm10gFixedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gSlotIndex.name: cm10gSlotIndex
cm10gSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gModelname.name: cm10gModelname
cm10gModelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm10gModelDesc.name: cm10gModelDesc
cm10gModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm10gHwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm10gHwJmp5ConfigMode
cm10gHwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware jumper J5 on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media converter module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm10gHwSw1OperationMode.name: cm10gHwSw1OperationMode
cm10gHwSw1OperationMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for operation mode. Data mode is for normal data transmission.

cm10gHwSw2LinkMode.name: cm10gHwSw2LinkMode
cm10gHwSw2LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode. If the Operation switch is set to Test, then this object indicates whether the port is in loopback or performing the build in link-test.

cm10gHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.name: cm10gHwSw3FiberFaultAlert
cm10gHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Fiber Fault Alert. If the Operation switch is set to Test, then this object indicates which port is in test mode

cm10gHwSw4Port1EdcMode.name: cm10gHwSw4Port1EdcMode
cm10gHwSw4Port1EdcMode.description: This oject indicates the current switch setting for EDC auto mode for port 1. This object only applies to SFP moudles.

cm10gHwSw5Port2EdcMode.name: cm10gHwSw5Port2EdcMode
cm10gHwSw5Port2EdcMode.description: This oject indicates the current switch setting for EDC auto mode for port 2. This object only applies to SFP moudles.

cm10gPort1LinkStatus.name: cm10gPort1LinkStatus
cm10gPort1LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 1).

cm10gPort1ConnType.name: cm10gPort1ConnType
cm10gPort1ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 1).

cm10gPort1AutoNegState.name: cm10gPort1AutoNegState
cm10gPort1AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 1).

cm10gPort1Speed.name: cm10gPort1Speed
cm10gPort1Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 1).

cm10gPort1Duplex.name: cm10gPort1Duplex
cm10gPort1Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm10gPort1PauseEnh.name: cm10gPort1PauseEnh
cm10gPort1PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm10gPort1ReceiveStatus.name: cm10gPort1ReceiveStatus
cm10gPort1ReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port (port 1)

cm10gPort2LinkStatus.name: cm10gPort2LinkStatus
cm10gPort2LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 2).

cm10gPort2ConnType.name: cm10gPort2ConnType
cm10gPort2ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 2).

cm10gPort2AutoNegState.name: cm10gPort2AutoNegState
cm10gPort2AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 2).

cm10gPort2Speed.name: cm10gPort2Speed
cm10gPort2Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 2).

cm10gPort2Duplex.name: cm10gPort2Duplex
cm10gPort2Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm10gPort2PauseEnh.name: cm10gPort2PauseEnh
cm10gPort2PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm10gPort2ReceiveStatus.name: cm10gPort2ReceiveStatus
cm10gPort2ReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port (port 2)

cm10gPortLoopBack.name: cm10gPortLoopBack
cm10gPortLoopBack.description: Media converter module's current port loopback mode setting. Writing to this object will change the current settings. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gPortTestMode.name: cm10gPortTestMode
cm10gPortTestMode.description: Media converter module's current port test mode setting.

cm10gConfigTable.name: cm10gConfigTable
cm10gConfigTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's configuration type information.

cm10gConfigEntry.name: cm10gConfigEntry
cm10gConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gConfigSlotIndex.name: cm10gConfigSlotIndex
cm10gConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gConfigStatus.name: cm10gConfigStatus
cm10gConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm10gConfigModuleName.name: cm10gConfigModuleName
cm10gConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm10gConfigLinkMode.name: cm10gConfigLinkMode
cm10gConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigFiberFaultAlert.name: cm10gConfigFiberFaultAlert
cm10gConfigFiberFaultAlert.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigFiberAutoNeg.name: cm10gConfigFiberAutoNeg
cm10gConfigFiberAutoNeg.description: This object identifies the wither fiber auto-negotiation is enabled for both ports. This only applies if 1G SFP modules are in use. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort1Name.name: cm10gConfigPort1Name
cm10gConfigPort1Name.description: This object identifies a user definable name for port 1.

cm10gConfigPort1Enable.name: cm10gConfigPort1Enable
cm10gConfigPort1Enable.description: This object identifies whether port 1 is enabled.

cm10gConfigPort1EdcMode.name: cm10gConfigPort1EdcMode
cm10gConfigPort1EdcMode.description: This object identifies the EDC mode for this port. This config option only applies for an SFP module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort1FecEnable.name: cm10gConfigPort1FecEnable
cm10gConfigPort1FecEnable.description: This object identifies the whether FEC control is enabled for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort1FecAmplitude.name: cm10gConfigPort1FecAmplitude
cm10gConfigPort1FecAmplitude.description: This object identifies the FEC Amplitude value for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort1FecPhase.name: cm10gConfigPort1FecPhase
cm10gConfigPort1FecPhase.description: This object identifies the FEC phase value for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort1WavelengthEnable.name: cm10gConfigPort1WavelengthEnable

cm10gConfigPort2WavelengthValue.name: cm10gConfigPort2WavelengthValue
cm10gConfigPort2WavelengthValue.description: This object identifies Wavelength fine tuning value for this port. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gConfigPort2ChannelEnable.name: cm10gConfigPort2ChannelEnable

cm10gConfigPort2TxDitherValue.name: cm10gConfigPort2TxDitherValue
cm10gConfigPort2TxDitherValue.description: This object identifies the whether TX Dither is enabled for this port. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gLedTable.name: cm10gLedTable
cm10gLedTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's LED status information.

cm10gLedEntry.name: cm10gLedEntry
cm10gLedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gLedsSlotIndex.name: cm10gLedsSlotIndex
cm10gLedsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gLedPWR.name: cm10gLedPWR
cm10gLedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Loopback or Link-Test enabled

cm10gLedLK1.name: cm10gLedLK1
cm10gLedLK1.description: This object identifies the status of the port 1 link (LK1) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

cm10gLedLK2.name: cm10gLedLK2
cm10gLedLK2.description: This object identifies the status of the port 2 link (LK2) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

exCMEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

exCMSlotIndex.name: exCMSlotIndex

exCMHwJmp5ConfigMode.name: exCMHwJmp5ConfigMode
exCMHwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware switch on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media module's hardware switches or jumpers.

exCMHwSw8EthDuplex.name: exCMHwSw8EthDuplex

exCMVdslRemoteLoopback.name: exCMVdslRemoteLoopback
exCMVdslRemoteLoopback.description: Write remoteLoopbackOff(1) or remoteLoopbackOn(2) to this object to set the loopback state of the remote VDSL peer. This object's value represents the last loopback command sent to the peer.

exCMVdslRemoteReset.name: exCMVdslRemoteReset
exCMVdslRemoteReset.description: Write resetRemotePeer(1) to this object to reset the remote VDSL peer. This object's value has no meaning

exCMEthernetLinkStatus.name: exCMEthernetLinkStatus
exCMEthernetLinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current Ethernet link status.

exCMEthernetConnType.name: exCMEthernetConnType
exCMEthernetConnType.description: Media converter module's Ethernet connector type.

exCMEthernetAutoNegState.name: exCMEthernetAutoNegState
exCMEthernetAutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current Ethernet auto-negotiation state.

exCMEthernetSpeed.name: exCMEthernetSpeed
exCMEthernetSpeed.description: If Ethernet auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current Ethernet auto-negotiated speed setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

exCMEthernetDuplex.name: exCMEthernetDuplex
exCMEthernetDuplex.description: If Ethernet auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current Ethernet auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

exCMEthernetCrossOver.name: exCMEthernetCrossOver
exCMEthernetCrossOver.description: If Ethernet auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current Ethernet auto-negotiated MDI/MDI-X setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

exCMEthernetPauseEnh.name: exCMEthernetPauseEnh
exCMEthernetPauseEnh.description: If Ethernet auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current Ethernet auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

exCMEthernetLPRFStatus.name: exCMEthernetLPRFStatus
exCMEthernetLPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's Ethernet Link Partner Remote Fault status.

exCMEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift.name: exCMEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift
exCMEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift.description: This object identifies the status of the Ethernet auto speed downshift feature. noDownshift indicates that an automatic downshift of the Ethernet speed has not occurred.

exCMEthernetMDI.name: exCMEthernetMDI
exCMEthernetMDI.description: This object identifies the Ethernet port's crossover status: MDI or MDI-X.

exCMVdslFirmwareVersion.name: exCMVdslFirmwareVersion
exCMVdslFirmwareVersion.description: This object identifies the version of the VDSL firmware.

exCMVdslFirmwareDate.name: exCMVdslFirmwareDate
exCMVdslFirmwareDate.description: This object identifies the date of the VDSL firmware

exCMVdslFirmwareDateString.name: exCMVdslFirmwareDateString
exCMVdslFirmwareDateString.description: This object identifies the version of the VDSL firmware, in human-readable format.

exCMConfigTable.name: exCMConfigTable
exCMConfigTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's configuration type information.

exCMConfigEntry.name: exCMConfigEntry
exCMConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

exCMConfigSlotIndex.name: exCMConfigSlotIndex
exCMConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the ex-CM type module is currently inserted

exCMConfigStatus.name: exCMConfigStatus
exCMConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

exCMConfigModuleName.name: exCMConfigModuleName
exCMConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

exCMConfigLinkMode.name: exCMConfigLinkMode
exCMConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigInterlinkFaultFeedback.name: exCMConfigInterlinkFaultFeedback
exCMConfigInterlinkFaultFeedback.description: This object identifies the interlink fault feedback setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigVdslPortName.name: exCMConfigVdslPortName
exCMConfigVdslPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the VDSL port.

exCMConfigVdslPortEnable.name: exCMConfigVdslPortEnable
exCMConfigVdslPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the VDSL port is enabled.

exCMConfigVdslProfileMode.name: exCMConfigVdslProfileMode
exCMConfigVdslProfileMode.description: This object specifies how the VDSL profile is selected. Auto: select through exCMConfigVdslRate and exCMConfigVdslSymmetry Manual: select through exCMConfigVdslProfile.

exCMConfigVdslRole.name: exCMConfigVdslRole
exCMConfigVdslRole.description: This object specifies the VDSL role: auto, local (CO), or remote (CPE).

exCMConfigVdslRate.name: exCMConfigVdslRate
exCMConfigVdslRate.description: This object specifies the VDSL rate/reach.

exCMConfigVdslSymmetry.name: exCMConfigVdslSymmetry
exCMConfigVdslSymmetry.description: This object specifies the VDSL band plan or symmetry.

exCMConfigVdslProfile.name: exCMConfigVdslProfile
exCMConfigVdslProfile.description: This object specifies the VDSL profile.

exCMConfigVdslOverrideProfile.name: exCMConfigVdslOverrideProfile
exCMConfigVdslOverrideProfile.description: This object specifies whether to override advanced VDSL profile settings (e.g exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioUp).

exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioUp.name: exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioUp
exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioUp.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting signal-to-noise ratio (upstream) in 0.1 dB.

exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateUp.name: exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateUp
exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateUp.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting minimum data rate (upstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateUp.name: exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateUp
exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateUp.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting maximum data rate (upstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayUp.name: exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayUp
exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayUp.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting maximum delay (upstream) in ms.

exCMConfigVdslMinInpUp.name: exCMConfigVdslMinInpUp
exCMConfigVdslMinInpUp.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting minimum INP (impulse noise protection) (upstream).

exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioDown.name: exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioDown
exCMConfigVdslSignalToNoiseRatioDown.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting signal-to-noise ratio (downstream) in 0.1 dB.

exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateDown.name: exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateDown
exCMConfigVdslMinDataRateDown.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting minimum data rate (downstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateDown.name: exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateDown
exCMConfigVdslMaxDataRateDown.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting maximum data rate (downstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayDown.name: exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayDown
exCMConfigVdslMaxInterleaveDelayDown.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting maximum delay (downstream) in ms.

exCMConfigVdslMinInpDown.name: exCMConfigVdslMinInpDown
exCMConfigVdslMinInpDown.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting minimum INP (impulse noise protection) (downstream).

exCMConfigVdslBitswapping.name: exCMConfigVdslBitswapping
exCMConfigVdslBitswapping.description: This object represents the advanced VDSL profile setting bitswapping.

exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmUp.name: exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmUp
exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmUp.description: This object represents the VDSL low bandwidth alarm threshold (upstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmDown.name: exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmDown
exCMConfigVdslLowBandwidthAlarmDown.description: This object represents the VDSL low bandwidth alarm threshold (downstream) in kbps.

exCMConfigEthernetPortName.name: exCMConfigEthernetPortName
exCMConfigEthernetPortName.description: This object identifies a user definable name for the ethernet port.

exCMConfigEthernetPortEnable.name: exCMConfigEthernetPortEnable
exCMConfigEthernetPortEnable.description: This object identifies whether the VDSL port is enabled.

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegotiation.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegotiation
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegotiation.description: This object identifies the whether ethernet auto-negotiation is enabled. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10HDX.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10HDX
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10HDX.description: This object controls whether or the ethernet port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10FDX.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10FDX
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv10FDX.description: This object controls whether or the ethernet port advertises willingness to connect at 10Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100HDX.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100HDX
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100HDX.description: This object controls whether or the ethernet port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, half duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100FDX.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100FDX
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv100FDX.description: This object controls whether or the ethernet port advertises willingness to connect at 100Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv1000FDX.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv1000FDX
exCMConfigEthernetAutoNegAdv1000FDX.description: This object controls whether or the ethernet port advertises willingness to connect at 1000Mbps, full duplex. This setting is ignored when auto-negotiation is disabled.

exCMConfigEthernetSpeed.name: exCMConfigEthernetSpeed
exCMConfigEthernetSpeed.description: If ethernet auto-negotiation is disabled then this object identifies the configured cooper speed. 1000 Mbps speed can only be auto negotiated. If ethernet auto-negotiation is enabled then this object is ignored. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigEthernetDuplex.name: exCMConfigEthernetDuplex
exCMConfigEthernetDuplex.description: If ethernet auto-negotiation is disabled then this object identifies the duplex setting for 10 & 100 Mbps for the ethernet port. Duplex for 1000 Mbps has to be auto negotiated. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigEthernetCrossOver.name: exCMConfigEthernetCrossOver
exCMConfigEthernetCrossOver.description: This object identifies the ethernet MDI/MDI-X setting.This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to

exCMConfigEthernetPauseEnh.name: exCMConfigEthernetPauseEnh
exCMConfigEthernetPauseEnh.description: This object identifies the ethernet pause (flow control) setting that is a advertised. The settings can be disabled, advertise symmetrical, advertise asymmetrical TX or advertise symmetrical and asymmetrical RX. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

exCMConfigEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift.name: exCMConfigEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift
exCMConfigEthernetAutoSpeedDownshift.description: This object identifies the number of times the PHY attempts to establish a Gigabit link before the PHY downshift to the next highest speed. A value of 0 indicates the auto downshift is disabled

exCMConfigEthernet10BaseTDistance.name: exCMConfigEthernet10BaseTDistance
exCMConfigEthernet10BaseTDistance.description: When using cable exceeding 100 meters in 10BASE-T mode this feature should be set to extended(1).

exCMConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.name: exCMConfigUnidirectionalEthernet
exCMConfigUnidirectionalEthernet.description: Restrict the flow of Ethernet traffic to a single direction. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap0.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap1.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 1. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap2.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 2. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap3.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 3. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap4.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 4. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap5.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 5. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap6.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7.name: exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7
exCMConfigPriorityToEgressQueueMap7.description: Set the egress queue of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernet8021pPriority.name: exCMConfigEthernet8021pPriority
exCMConfigEthernet8021pPriority.description: Use 802.1p tag priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetIpTosPriority.name: exCMConfigEthernetIpTosPriority
exCMConfigEthernetIpTosPriority.description: Use IP TOS priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityPrecedence.name: exCMConfigEthernetPriorityPrecedence
exCMConfigEthernetPriorityPrecedence.description: Configure priority precedence. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetCongestionPolicy.name: exCMConfigEthernetCongestionPolicy
exCMConfigEthernetCongestionPolicy.description: Configure priority congestion policy. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap0.name: exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap0
exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap0.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap1.name: exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap1
exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap1.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 1. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap2.name: exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap2
exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap2.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 2. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap5.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 5. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap6.name: exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap6
exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap6.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetPriorityMap7.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetIngressLimit.name: exCMConfigEthernetIngressLimit
exCMConfigEthernetIngressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of incoming packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetEgressLimit.name: exCMConfigEthernetEgressLimit
exCMConfigEthernetEgressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of outgoing packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetDiscardTaggedFrames.name: exCMConfigEthernetDiscardTaggedFrames
exCMConfigEthernetDiscardTaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of tagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetDiscardUntaggedFrames.name: exCMConfigEthernetDiscardUntaggedFrames
exCMConfigEthernetDiscardUntaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of untagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetDefaultVlanId.name: exCMConfigEthernetDefaultVlanId
exCMConfigEthernetDefaultVlanId.description: Set the default VLAN ID to insert when tagging frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetDefaultPriority.name: exCMConfigEthernetDefaultPriority
exCMConfigEthernetDefaultPriority.description: Set the default frame priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetVlanTaggingAction.name: exCMConfigEthernetVlanTaggingAction
exCMConfigEthernetVlanTaggingAction.description: Set the default tagging action. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownMulticast.name: exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownMulticast
exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownMulticast.description: Enable filtering of multicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownUnicast.name: exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownUnicast
exCMConfigEthernetFilterUnknownUnicast.description: Enable filtering of unicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdsl8021pPriority.name: exCMConfigVdsl8021pPriority
exCMConfigVdsl8021pPriority.description: Use 802.1p tag priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslIpTosPriority.name: exCMConfigVdslIpTosPriority
exCMConfigVdslIpTosPriority.description: Use IP TOS priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityPrecedence.name: exCMConfigVdslPriorityPrecedence
exCMConfigVdslPriorityPrecedence.description: Configure priority precedence. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslCongestionPolicy.name: exCMConfigVdslCongestionPolicy
exCMConfigVdslCongestionPolicy.description: Configure priority congestion policy. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap0.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 0. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap2.name: exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap2
exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap2.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 2. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).
