exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap4.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 4. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap5.name: exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap5
exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap5.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 5. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap6.name: exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap6
exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap6.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 6. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap7.name: exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap7
exCMConfigVdslPriorityMap7.description: Change the priority of frames tagged with 802.1p priority 7. A value of -1 signifies that this feature is not supported by the current media converter module firmware. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslIngressLimit.name: exCMConfigVdslIngressLimit
exCMConfigVdslIngressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of incoming packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslEgressLimit.name: exCMConfigVdslEgressLimit
exCMConfigVdslEgressLimit.description: Set a limit on the rate of outgoing packets. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslDiscardTaggedFrames.name: exCMConfigVdslDiscardTaggedFrames
exCMConfigVdslDiscardTaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of tagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslDiscardUntaggedFrames.name: exCMConfigVdslDiscardUntaggedFrames
exCMConfigVdslDiscardUntaggedFrames.description: Enable discarding of untagged frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslDefaultVlanId.name: exCMConfigVdslDefaultVlanId
exCMConfigVdslDefaultVlanId.description: Set the default VLAN ID to insert when tagging frames. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslDefaultPriority.name: exCMConfigVdslDefaultPriority
exCMConfigVdslDefaultPriority.description: Set the default frame priority. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslVlanTaggingAction.name: exCMConfigVdslVlanTaggingAction
exCMConfigVdslVlanTaggingAction.description: Set the default tagging action. (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownMulticast.name: exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownMulticast
exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownMulticast.description: Enable filtering of multicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownUnicast.name: exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownUnicast
exCMConfigVdslFilterUnknownUnicast.description: Enable filtering of unicast frames with an unknown destination (This feature may require a media converter module firmware upgrade).

exCMConfigVdslFastMode.name: exCMConfigVdslFastMode
exCMConfigVdslFastMode.description: This object represents the VDSL fast mode setting.

exCMLedTable.name: exCMLedTable
exCMLedTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's LED status information.

exCMLedEntry.name: exCMLedEntry
exCMLedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

exCMLedSlotIndex.name: exCMLedSlotIndex
exCMLedSlotIndex.description: The Slot number of the module

exCMLedILNK.name: exCMLedILNK
exCMLedILNK.description: This object identifies the status of the ILNK (InterLink) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: slowBlinkingGreen(1) - ILNK port is idle or handshaking fastBlinkingGreen(2) - ILNK port is training green(3) - ILNK port is up

exCMLedLOC.name: exCMLedLOC
exCMLedLOC.description: This object identifies the status of the Local (LOC) LED on the media converter module. When this LED is green, it indicates that the InterLink port's VDSL role is local.

exCMLedPWR.name: exCMLedPWR
exCMLedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - InterLink loopback enabled

exCMLedETH.name: exCMLedETH
exCMLedETH.description: This object identifies the status of the ETH (Ethernet) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - ETH port is down slowBlinkingGreen(1) - ETH port is down, due to the VDSL port or peer copper ethernet port being down green(2) - ETH port is up

exCMLedRMT.name: exCMLedRMT
exCMLedRMT.description: This object identifies the status of the Remote (RMT) LED on the media converter module. When this LED is green, it indicates that the InterLink port's VDSL role is remote.

exCMStatsTable.name: exCMStatsTable
exCMStatsTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's configuration and status type information.

exCMStatsEntry.name: exCMStatsEntry
exCMStatsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

exCMStatsSlotIndex.name: exCMStatsSlotIndex
exCMStatsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the ex-1CM type module is currently inserted

exCMMediaPortIndex.name: exCMMediaPortIndex
exCMMediaPortIndex.description: Media converter module port index indicating which media port the statistical counters are associated with.

exCMPortInDiscards.name: exCMPortInDiscards
exCMPortInDiscards.description: A counter that counts the number of good, non-filtered frames that normally would have been forwarded, but could not due to lack of buffer space.

exCMPortInFiltered.name: exCMPortInFiltered
exCMPortInFiltered.description: A counter that counts the number of good frames that were filtered due to ingress switch policy rules.

exCMPortInGoodOctets.name: exCMPortInGoodOctets
exCMPortInGoodOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames received on the media port.

exCMPortHCInGoodOctets.name: exCMPortHCInGoodOctets
exCMPortHCInGoodOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames received on the media port. This object is a 64-bit version of exCMPortInGoodOctets.

exCMPortInBadOctets.name: exCMPortInBadOctets
exCMPortInBadOctets.description: An ingress counter that is the sum of lengths of all bad Ethernet frames received on the media port..

exCMPortInUnicasts.name: exCMPortInUnicasts
exCMPortInUnicasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

exCMPortInBroadcasts.name: exCMPortInBroadcasts
exCMPortInBroadcasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

exCMPortInMulticasts.name: exCMPortInMulticasts
exCMPortInMulticasts.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames received that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the exCMPortInPauses or the exCMPortInBroadcasts objects.

exCMPortInPauses.name: exCMPortInPauses
exCMPortInPauses.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of good frames reachieved that have a Pause destination MAC address.

exCMPortInUnderSizes.name: exCMPortInUnderSizes
exCMPortInUnderSizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets but with a valid FCS.

exCMPortInFragments.name: exCMPortInFragments
exCMPortInFragments.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length less that 64 octets and an invalid FCS.

exCMPortInOversizes.name: exCMPortInOversizes
exCMPortInOversizes.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a valid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the exCMConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

exCMPortInJabbers.name: exCMPortInJabbers
exCMPortInJabbers.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a length more than the maximum packet size but with a invalid FCS. The maximum packet size can be set using the exCMConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

exCMPortInRxErrs.name: exCMPortInRxErrs
exCMPortInRxErrs.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with an RxErr signal from the PHY.

exCMPortInFcsErrs.name: exCMPortInFcsErrs
exCMPortInFcsErrs.description: An ingress counter that counts the number of frames received with a CRC error not counted in the exCMPortInFragments, exCMPortInFcsErr, or the exCMPortInRxErr objects.

exCMPortPkts64Octets.name: exCMPortPkts64Octets
exCMPortPkts64Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of exactly 64 Octets, including those with errors.

exCMPortPkts65to127Octets.name: exCMPortPkts65to127Octets
exCMPortPkts65to127Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 65 and 127 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

exCMPortPkts128to255Octets.name: exCMPortPkts128to255Octets
exCMPortPkts128to255Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 128 and 255 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

exCMPortPkts256to511Octets.name: exCMPortPkts256to511Octets
exCMPortPkts256to511Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 256 and 511 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

exCMPortPkts512to1023Octets.name: exCMPortPkts512to1023Octets
exCMPortPkts512to1023Octets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 512 and 1023 Octets inclusive, including those with errors.

exCMPortPkts1024toMaxOctets.name: exCMPortPkts1024toMaxOctets
exCMPortPkts1024toMaxOctets.description: A Histogram counter that counts the number of frames received and transmitted with a length of between 1024 and maximum packet size octets inclusive, including those with errors. The maximum packet size can be set using the exCMConfigMaxPacketsSize object.

exCMPortOutOctets.name: exCMPortOutOctets
exCMPortOutOctets.description: An Egress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames sent on the media port.

exCMPortHCOutOctets.name: exCMPortHCOutOctets
exCMPortHCOutOctets.description: An Egress counter that is the sum of lengths of all good Ethernet frames sent on the media port. This object is a 64-bit version of exCMPortOutOctets.

exCMPortOutFiltered.name: exCMPortOutFiltered
exCMPortOutFiltered.description: A counter that counts the number of good frames that were filtered due to egress switch policy rules.

exCMPortOutUnicasts.name: exCMPortOutUnicasts
exCMPortOutUnicasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Unicast destination MAC address.

exCMPortOutBroadcasts.name: exCMPortOutBroadcasts
exCMPortOutBroadcasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Broadcast destination MAC address.

exCMPortOutMulticasts.name: exCMPortOutMulticasts
exCMPortOutMulticasts.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames sent that have a Multicast destination MAC address. This count does not include frames counted in the exCMPortOutPauses or the exCMPortOutBroadcasts objects.

exCMPortOutPauses.name: exCMPortOutPauses
exCMPortOutPauses.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of good frames reachieved that have a Pause destination MAC address.

exCMPortDeferreds.name: exCMPortDeferreds
exCMPortDeferreds.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced no collisions but are delayed because the medium was busy during the first attempt. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortCollisions.name: exCMPortCollisions
exCMPortCollisions.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of collision events seen by the MAC not including those counted in exCMPortSingles, exCMPortMultiple , exCMPortExcessives or exCMPortLates objects. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortSingles.name: exCMPortSingles
exCMPortSingles.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced exactly one collision. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortMultiples.name: exCMPortMultiples
exCMPortMultiples.description: An Egress counter that counts the number of successfully transmitted frames that experienced more than one collision. This counter is aplicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortExcessives.name: exCMPortExcessives
exCMPortExcessives.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames dropped in the transmit MAC because the frame experienced 16 consecutive collisions. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortLates.name: exCMPortLates
exCMPortLates.description: An Egress counter that counts the number times a collision is detected later than 512 bits-times into the transmission of a frame. This counter is applicable in half-duplex only.

exCMPortOutFcsErrs.name: exCMPortOutFcsErrs
exCMPortOutFcsErrs.description: An Egress counter that counts the number frames transmitted with an invalid FCS.

exCMPortResetCounters.name: exCMPortResetCounters
exCMPortResetCounters.description: Allows the resetting of all exCMStats statistical counters for this port.

exCMVdslStatsTable.name: exCMVdslStatsTable
exCMVdslStatsTable.description: Table of CM-1110 type media converter module's configuration and status type information.

exCMVdslStatsEntry.name: exCMVdslStatsEntry
exCMVdslStatsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-1110 type media converter module.

exCMVdslStatsSlotIndex.name: exCMVdslStatsSlotIndex
exCMVdslStatsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the ex-1CM type module is currently inserted

exCMVdslStatsMediaPortIndex.name: exCMVdslStatsMediaPortIndex
exCMVdslStatsMediaPortIndex.description: Media converter module port index indicating which media port the statistical counters are associated with.

exCMVdslStatsTimePeriod.name: exCMVdslStatsTimePeriod
exCMVdslStatsTimePeriod.description: Media converter module port index indicating which media port the statistical counters are associated with.

exCMVdslStatsFullInitLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsFullInitLocal
exCMVdslStatsFullInitLocal.description: The VDSL port's fully initialized (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationLocal
exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationLocal.description: The VDSL port's code violation (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsFecSecsLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsFecSecsLocal
exCMVdslStatsFecSecsLocal.description: The VDSL port's forward error correction seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsLocal
exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsLocal.description: The VDSL port's errored seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsLocal
exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsLocal.description: The VDSL port's severely errored seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsLocal
exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsLocal.description: The VDSL port's loss of signal seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsLocal
exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsLocal.description: The VDSL port's unavailable seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedLocal.name: exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedLocal
exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedLocal.description: The VDSL port's elapsed time in seconds (local) count.

exCMVdslStatsFullInitRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsFullInitRemote
exCMVdslStatsFullInitRemote.description: The VDSL port's fully initialized (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationRemote
exCMVdslStatsCodeViolationRemote.description: The VDSL port's code violation (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsFecSecsRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsFecSecsRemote
exCMVdslStatsFecSecsRemote.description: The VDSL port's forward error correction seconds (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsRemote
exCMVdslStatsErroredSecsRemote.description: The VDSL port's errored seconds (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsRemote
exCMVdslStatsSeverelyErroredSecsRemote.description: The VDSL port's severely errored seconds (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsRemote
exCMVdslStatsLossOfSignalSecsRemote.description: The VDSL port's loss of signal seconds (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsRemote
exCMVdslStatsUnavailableSecsRemote.description: The VDSL port's unavailable seconds (remote) count.

exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedRemote.name: exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedRemote
exCMVdslStatsTimeElapsedRemote.description: The VDSL port's elapsed time in seconds (remote) count.

exCMAvctTable.name: exCMAvctTable
exCMAvctTable.description: Table of ex-CM media converter modules.

exCMAvctEntry.name: exCMAvctEntry
exCMAvctEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a copper Ethernet port on the eX-CM type media converter module.

exCMAvctSlotIndex.name: exCMAvctSlotIndex
exCMAvctSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the eX-CM type module is currently inserted

exCMAvctStart.name: exCMAvctStart
exCMAvctStart.description: Set this self-clearing variable to yes initiate the Advanced Virtual Cable Test. Note: During the test, no network data will be passed.

exCMAvctStatus.name: exCMAvctStatus
exCMAvctStatus.description: This object identifies the state of the Advanced Virtual Cable Tester.

exCMAvctTxRxPair1Results.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair1Results
exCMAvctTxRxPair1Results.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of the Tx/Rx pair one.

exCMAvctTxRxPair1Amplitude.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair1Amplitude
exCMAvctTxRxPair1Amplitude.description: Amplitude of Tx/Rx pair one in millivolts when test result codes is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair1Distance.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair1Distance
exCMAvctTxRxPair1Distance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes for Tx/Rx pair one is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair2Results.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair2Results
exCMAvctTxRxPair2Results.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of the Tx/Rx pair two.

exCMAvctTxRxPair2Amplitude.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair2Amplitude
exCMAvctTxRxPair2Amplitude.description: Amplitude of Tx/Rx pair two in millivolts when test result codes is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair2Distance.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair2Distance
exCMAvctTxRxPair2Distance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes for Tx/Rx pair two is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair3Results.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair3Results
exCMAvctTxRxPair3Results.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of the Tx/Rx pair three.

exCMAvctTxRxPair3Amplitude.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair3Amplitude
exCMAvctTxRxPair3Amplitude.description: Amplitude of Tx/Rx pair three in millivolts when test result codes is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair3Distance.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair3Distance
exCMAvctTxRxPair3Distance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes for Tx/Rx pair three is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair4Results.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair4Results
exCMAvctTxRxPair4Results.description: Test result code returned from Virtual Cable Test of Tx/Rx pair four.

exCMAvctTxRxPair4Amplitude.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair4Amplitude
exCMAvctTxRxPair4Amplitude.description: Amplitude of Tx/Rx pair four in millivolts when test result codes is short or open.

exCMAvctTxRxPair4Distance.name: exCMAvctTxRxPair4Distance
exCMAvctTxRxPair4Distance.description: Distance in meters to fault when test result codes for Tx/Rx pair four is short or open.

cm10gtTable.name: cm10gtTable
cm10gtTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's status type information.

cm10gtEntry.name: cm10gtEntry
cm10gtEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gtSlotIndex.name: cm10gtSlotIndex
cm10gtSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gtModelname.name: cm10gtModelname
cm10gtModelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm10gtModelDesc.name: cm10gtModelDesc
cm10gtModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm10gtHwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm10gtHwJmp5ConfigMode
cm10gtHwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware jumper J5 on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media converter module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm10gtHwSw1OperationMode.name: cm10gtHwSw1OperationMode
cm10gtHwSw1OperationMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for operation mode. Data mode is for normal data transmission.

cm10gtHwSw2LinkMode.name: cm10gtHwSw2LinkMode
cm10gtHwSw2LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode. If the Operation switch is set to Test, then this object indicates whether the port is in loopback or performing the build in link-test.

cm10gtHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.name: cm10gtHwSw3FiberFaultAlert
cm10gtHwSw3FiberFaultAlert.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Fiber Fault Alert. If the Operation switch is set to Test, then this object indicates which port is in test mode

cm10gtHwSw4EnergyEfficentEthernet.name: cm10gtHwSw4EnergyEfficentEthernet
cm10gtHwSw4EnergyEfficentEthernet.description: This object indicates the current switch setting for Energy Efficient Ethernet on port 2.

cm10gtHwSw5Unused.name: cm10gtHwSw5Unused
cm10gtHwSw5Unused.description: This object indicates the current switch setting for dip switch 5, which is unused.

cm10gtPort1LinkStatus.name: cm10gtPort1LinkStatus
cm10gtPort1LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 1).

cm10gtPort1ConnType.name: cm10gtPort1ConnType
cm10gtPort1ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 1).

cm10gtPort1AutoNegState.name: cm10gtPort1AutoNegState
cm10gtPort1AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 1).

cm10gtPort1Speed.name: cm10gtPort1Speed
cm10gtPort1Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 1).

cm10gtPort1Duplex.name: cm10gtPort1Duplex
cm10gtPort1Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm10gtPort1PauseEnh.name: cm10gtPort1PauseEnh
cm10gtPort1PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 1)

cm10gtPort1ReceiveStatus.name: cm10gtPort1ReceiveStatus
cm10gtPort1ReceiveStatus.description: This object identifies the status of whether light is being received on the fiber port (port 1)

cm10gtPort1LPRFStatus.name: cm10gtPort1LPRFStatus
cm10gtPort1LPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's Link Partner Remote Fault status (port 1). This object only applies to SFP modules running at 1G, with auto-negotiation enabled.

cm10gtPort2LinkStatus.name: cm10gtPort2LinkStatus
cm10gtPort2LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 2).

cm10gtPort2ConnType.name: cm10gtPort2ConnType
cm10gtPort2ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 2).

cm10gtPort2AutoNegState.name: cm10gtPort2AutoNegState
cm10gtPort2AutoNegState.description: Media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiation state (port 2).

cm10gtPort2Speed.name: cm10gtPort2Speed
cm10gtPort2Speed.description: Media converter module's fiber port speed in megabits per second (port 2).

cm10gtPort2Duplex.name: cm10gtPort2Duplex
cm10gtPort2Duplex.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated duplex setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm10gtPort2PauseEnh.name: cm10gtPort2PauseEnh
cm10gtPort2PauseEnh.description: If fiber auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current fiber auto-negotiated pause setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored. (Port 2)

cm10gtPort2LPRFStatus.name: cm10gtPort2LPRFStatus
cm10gtPort2LPRFStatus.description: Media converter module's copper Link Partner Remote Fault status.

cm10gtPortLoopBack.name: cm10gtPortLoopBack
cm10gtPortLoopBack.description: Media converter module's current port loopback mode setting. Writing to this object will change the current settings. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtPortTestMode.name: cm10gtPortTestMode
cm10gtPortTestMode.description: Media converter module's current port test mode setting.

cm10gtConfigTable.name: cm10gtConfigTable
cm10gtConfigTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's configuration type information.

cm10gtConfigEntry.name: cm10gtConfigEntry
cm10gtConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gtConfigSlotIndex.name: cm10gtConfigSlotIndex
cm10gtConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gtConfigStatus.name: cm10gtConfigStatus
cm10gtConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm10gtConfigModuleName.name: cm10gtConfigModuleName
cm10gtConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm10gtConfigLinkMode.name: cm10gtConfigLinkMode
cm10gtConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigFiberFaultAlert.name: cm10gtConfigFiberFaultAlert
cm10gtConfigFiberFaultAlert.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigFiberAutoNeg.name: cm10gtConfigFiberAutoNeg
cm10gtConfigFiberAutoNeg.description: This object identifies the wither fiber auto-negotiation is enabled for both ports. This only applies if 1G SFP modules are in use. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1Name.name: cm10gtConfigPort1Name
cm10gtConfigPort1Name.description: This object identifies a user definable name for port 1.

cm10gtConfigPort1Enable.name: cm10gtConfigPort1Enable
cm10gtConfigPort1Enable.description: This object identifies whether port 1 is enabled.

cm10gtConfigPort1FecEnable.name: cm10gtConfigPort1FecEnable
cm10gtConfigPort1FecEnable.description: This object identifies the whether FEC control is enabled for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1FecAmplitude.name: cm10gtConfigPort1FecAmplitude
cm10gtConfigPort1FecAmplitude.description: This object identifies the FEC Amplitude value for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1FecPhase.name: cm10gtConfigPort1FecPhase
cm10gtConfigPort1FecPhase.description: This object identifies the FEC phase value for this port. This config option only applies for an XFP module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthEnable.name: cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthEnable
cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthEnable.description: This object identifies whether Wavelength fine tuning is enabled for this port. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthValue.name: cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthValue
cm10gtConfigPort1WavelengthValue.description: This object identifies Wavelength fine tuning value for this port. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelEnable.name: cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelEnable
cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelEnable.description: This object identifies whether channel number fine tuning is enabled for this port. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelNumber.name: cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelNumber
cm10gtConfigPort1ChannelNumber.description: This object identifies the channel number fine tuning value for this port. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherEnable.name: cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherEnable
cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherEnable.description: This object identifies the whether TX Dither control is enabled on this port. If not enabled the default TX Dither value will be used. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherValue.name: cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherValue
cm10gtConfigPort1TxDitherValue.description: This object identifies the whether TX Dither is enabled for this port. This object is read-only if the media module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm10gtConfigPort2Name.name: cm10gtConfigPort2Name
cm10gtConfigPort2Name.description: This object identifies a user definable name for port 2.

cm10gtConfigPort2Enable.name: cm10gtConfigPort2Enable
cm10gtConfigPort2Enable.description: This object identifies whether port 2 is enabled.

cm10gtConfigPort2CopperDuplex.name: cm10gtConfigPort2CopperDuplex
cm10gtConfigPort2CopperDuplex.description: This object identifies the duplex settings for the copper port.

cm10gtConfigPort2CopperPauseEnh.name: cm10gtConfigPort2CopperPauseEnh
cm10gtConfigPort2CopperPauseEnh.description: This object identifies the copper pause (flow control) setting that is a advertised. The settings can be disabled, advertise symmetrical, advertise asymmetrical TX or advertise symmetrical and asymmetrical RX.

cm10gtConfigPort2CopperEnergyEfficientEt.name: cm10gtConfigPort2CopperEnergyEfficientEthernet
cm10gtConfigPort2CopperEnergyEfficientEt.description: This object identifies the copper Energy-Efficient Ethernet setting for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm10gtLedTable.name: cm10gtLedTable
cm10gtLedTable.description: Table of CM-10G type media converter module's LED status information.

cm10gtLedEntry.name: cm10gtLedEntry
cm10gtLedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-10G type media converter module.

cm10gtLedsSlotIndex.name: cm10gtLedsSlotIndex
cm10gtLedsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-10G type module is currently inserted

cm10gtLedPWR.name: cm10gtLedPWR
cm10gtLedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Loopback or Link-Test enabled

cm10gtLedLK1.name: cm10gtLedLK1
cm10gtLedLK1.description: This object identifies the status of the port 1 link (LK1) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

cm10gtLedLK2.name: cm10gtLedLK2
cm10gtLedLK2.description: This object identifies the status of the port 2 link (LK2) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

cm4gptTable.name: cm4gptTable
cm4gptTable.description: Table of CM-4GPT type media converter module's status type information.

cm4gptEntry.name: cm4gptEntry
cm4gptEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-4GPT type media converter module.

cm4gptSlotIndex.name: cm4gptSlotIndex
cm4gptSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-4GPT type module is currently inserted

cm4gptModelname.name: cm4gptModelname
cm4gptModelname.description: This object identifies the model of media converter module present in the chassis

cm4gptModelDesc.name: cm4gptModelDesc
cm4gptModelDesc.description: This object identifies a static description of the media converter module present in the chassis

cm4gptHwJmp5ConfigMode.name: cm4gptHwJmp5ConfigMode
cm4gptHwJmp5ConfigMode.description: This object identifies the media converter module's ConfigMode, set by hardware jumper J5 on the media converter module. When this object is set to hardwareSwitches(0), the media converter module will disable configuration control from the management module's software and all configuration control comes from the media converter module's hardware switches or jumpers.

cm4gptHwSw1LinkMode.name: cm4gptHwSw1LinkMode
cm4gptHwSw1LinkMode.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Link Mode.

cm4gptHwSw2FiberFaultAlert.name: cm4gptHwSw2FiberFaultAlert
cm4gptHwSw2FiberFaultAlert.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Fiber Fault Alert.

cm4gptHwSw3RateSelect.name: cm4gptHwSw3RateSelect
cm4gptHwSw3RateSelect.description: Media converter module's current switch setting for Rate Select.

cm4gptHwSw4Unused.name: cm4gptHwSw4Unused
cm4gptHwSw4Unused.description: This object indicates the current switch setting for the 4th, unused switch.

cm4gptPort1LinkStatus.name: cm4gptPort1LinkStatus
cm4gptPort1LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 1).

cm4gptPort1ConnType.name: cm4gptPort1ConnType
cm4gptPort1ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 1).

cm4gptPort2LinkStatus.name: cm4gptPort2LinkStatus
cm4gptPort2LinkStatus.description: Media converter module's current fiber link status (port 2).

cm4gptPort2ConnType.name: cm4gptPort2ConnType
cm4gptPort2ConnType.description: Media converter module's fiber port connector type (port 2).

cm4gptConfigTable.name: cm4gptConfigTable
cm4gptConfigTable.description: Table of CM-4GPT type media converter module's configuration type information.

cm4gptConfigEntry.name: cm4gptConfigEntry
cm4gptConfigEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-4GPT type media converter module.

cm4gptConfigSlotIndex.name: cm4gptConfigSlotIndex
cm4gptConfigSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-4GPT type module is currently inserted

cm4gptConfigStatus.name: cm4gptConfigStatus
cm4gptConfigStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module, verified and and saved to flash. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cm4gptConfigModuleName.name: cm4gptConfigModuleName
cm4gptConfigModuleName.description: This object identifies a user configurable name for the media converter module present in the chassis.

cm4gptConfigLinkMode.name: cm4gptConfigLinkMode
cm4gptConfigLinkMode.description: This object identifies the Link Mode for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm4gptConfigFiberFaultAlert.name: cm4gptConfigFiberFaultAlert
cm4gptConfigFiberFaultAlert.description: This object identifies the Fiber Fault Alert setting for the media module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm4gptConfigRateSelect.name: cm4gptConfigRateSelect
cm4gptConfigRateSelect.description: This object identifies the Rate Select setting for the media converter module. This object is read-only if the media converter module's ConfigMode jumper is set to hardwareSwitches(0).

cm4gptConfigPort1Name.name: cm4gptConfigPort1Name
cm4gptConfigPort1Name.description: This object identifies a user definable name for port 1.

cm4gptConfigPort1Enable.name: cm4gptConfigPort1Enable
cm4gptConfigPort1Enable.description: This object identifies whether port 1 is enabled.

cm4gptConfigPort2Name.name: cm4gptConfigPort2Name
cm4gptConfigPort2Name.description: This object identifies a user definable name for port 2.

cm4gptConfigPort2Enable.name: cm4gptConfigPort2Enable
cm4gptConfigPort2Enable.description: This object identifies whether port 2 is enabled.

cm4gptLedTable.name: cm4gptLedTable
cm4gptLedTable.description: Table of CM-4GPT type media converter module's LED status information.

cm4gptLedEntry.name: cm4gptLedEntry
cm4gptLedEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate CM-4GPT type media converter module.

cm4gptLedsSlotIndex.name: cm4gptLedsSlotIndex
cm4gptLedsSlotIndex.description: The Slot number the CM-4GPT type module is currently inserted

cm4gptLedPWR.name: cm4gptLedPWR
cm4gptLedPWR.description: This object identifies the status of the power (PWR) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No power to the module onGreen(1) - Power being applied to module blinking(2) - Loopback or Link-Test enabled

cm4gptLedLK1.name: cm4gptLedLK1
cm4gptLedLK1.description: This object identifies the status of the port 1 link (LK1) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

cm4gptLedLK2.name: cm4gptLedLK2
cm4gptLedLK2.description: This object identifies the status of the port 2 link (LK2) LED on the media converter module. Possible status values are: off(0) - No link on(1) - Port link present

mcrSfpDmiModuleTable.name: mcrSfpDmiModuleTable
mcrSfpDmiModuleTable.description: Table of SFP Diagnostic Monitoring Interface information for Optical Transceivers

mcrSfpDmiModuleEntry.name: mcrSfpDmiModuleEntry
mcrSfpDmiModuleEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate SFP module.

sfpDmiSlotIndex.name: sfpDmiSlotIndex
sfpDmiSlotIndex.description: The Slot number of the media converter module containing this SFP/XFP

sfpDmiStatus.name: sfpDmiStatus
sfpDmiStatus.description: This object identifies the status of the SFP module. If sfpCommFailed bit is set then the rest of the data in this entry is invalid

sfpDmiConnectorType.name: sfpDmiConnectorType
sfpDmiConnectorType.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI connector type.

sfpDmiNominalBitRate.name: sfpDmiNominalBitRate
sfpDmiNominalBitRate.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI nominal bit rate of fiber interface, in megabits per second.

sfpDmiLinkReach9125.name: sfpDmiLinkReach9125
sfpDmiLinkReach9125.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI maximum length in meters of media supported by the fiber transceiver for 9 micron (125 micron jacket) single-mode fiber.

sfpDmiLinkReach50125.name: sfpDmiLinkReach50125
sfpDmiLinkReach50125.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI maximum length in meters of media supported by the fiber transceiver for 50 micron (125 micron jacket) multi-mode fiber.

sfpDmiLinkReach625125.name: sfpDmiLinkReach625125
sfpDmiLinkReach625125.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI maximum length in meters of media supported by the fiber transceiver for 62.5 micron (125 micron jacket) multi-mode fiber.

sfpDmiFiberWaveLength.name: sfpDmiFiberWaveLength
sfpDmiFiberWaveLength.description: This object identifies the wavelength of the fiber interface's optical transceiver, in nanometers.

sfpDmiCurrentTempState.name: sfpDmiCurrentTempState
sfpDmiCurrentTempState.description: This object identifies the current alarm status for SFP DMI internally measured temperature.

sfpDmiRealTimeTemp.name: sfpDmiRealTimeTemp
sfpDmiRealTimeTemp.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI real time temperature. The value displayed will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighTempWarn.name: sfpDmiHighTempWarn
sfpDmiHighTempWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high temperature warning threshold. The value displayed will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighTempAlarm.name: sfpDmiHighTempAlarm
sfpDmiHighTempAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high temperature warning threshold. The value displayed will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowTempWarn.name: sfpDmiLowTempWarn
sfpDmiLowTempWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high temperature warning threshold. The value displayed will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowTempAlarm.name: sfpDmiLowTempAlarm
sfpDmiLowTempAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high temperature warning threshold. The value displayed will be either Celsius or Fahrenheit based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiCurrentVoltState.name: sfpDmiCurrentVoltState
sfpDmiCurrentVoltState.description: This object identifies current alarm status for SFP DMI internally measured voltage.

sfpDmiRealTimeVolt.name: sfpDmiRealTimeVolt
sfpDmiRealTimeVolt.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI real time voltage in Volts.

sfpDmiHighVoltWarn.name: sfpDmiHighVoltWarn
sfpDmiHighVoltWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high voltage warning threshold in Volts

sfpDmiHighVoltAlarm.name: sfpDmiHighVoltAlarm
sfpDmiHighVoltAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high voltage warning threshold in Volts

sfpDmiLowVoltWarn.name: sfpDmiLowVoltWarn
sfpDmiLowVoltWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high voltage warning threshold in Volts

sfpDmiLowVoltAlarm.name: sfpDmiLowVoltAlarm
sfpDmiLowVoltAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high voltage warning threshold in Volts

sfpDmiCurrentTxBiasState.name: sfpDmiCurrentTxBiasState
sfpDmiCurrentTxBiasState.description: This object identifies current alarm status for SFP DMI internally measured transmit bias current in milliamps.

sfpDmiRealTimeTxBias.name: sfpDmiRealTimeTxBias
sfpDmiRealTimeTxBias.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high TX Bias current in milliamps.

sfpDmiHighTxBiasWarn.name: sfpDmiHighTxBiasWarn
sfpDmiHighTxBiasWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high TX Bias current warning threshold in milliamps.

sfpDmiHighTxBiasAlarm.name: sfpDmiHighTxBiasAlarm
sfpDmiHighTxBiasAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high TX Bias current alarm threshold in milliamps.

sfpDmiLowTxBiasWarn.name: sfpDmiLowTxBiasWarn
sfpDmiLowTxBiasWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low TX Bias current warning threshold in milliamps.

sfpDmiLowTxBiasAlarm.name: sfpDmiLowTxBiasAlarm
sfpDmiLowTxBiasAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low TX Bias current alarm threshold in milliamps.

sfpDmiCurrentTxPowerState.name: sfpDmiCurrentTxPowerState
sfpDmiCurrentTxPowerState.description: This object identifies current alarm status for SFP DMI internally measured transmit power.

sfpDmiRealTimeTxPower.name: sfpDmiRealTimeTxPower
sfpDmiRealTimeTxPower.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI real time TX output power. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighTxPowerWarn.name: sfpDmiHighTxPowerWarn
sfpDmiHighTxPowerWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high TX output power warning threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighTxPowerAlarm.name: sfpDmiHighTxPowerAlarm
sfpDmiHighTxPowerAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high TX output power alarm threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowTxPowerWarn.name: sfpDmiLowTxPowerWarn
sfpDmiLowTxPowerWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low TX output power warning threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowTxPowerAlarm.name: sfpDmiLowTxPowerAlarm
sfpDmiLowTxPowerAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low TX output power alarm threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiCurrentRxPowerState.name: sfpDmiCurrentRxPowerState
sfpDmiCurrentRxPowerState.description: This object identifies current alarm status for SFP DMI internally measured receive power.

sfpDmiRealTimeRxPower.name: sfpDmiRealTimeRxPower
sfpDmiRealTimeRxPower.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI real time RX received optical power. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighRxPowerWarn.name: sfpDmiHighRxPowerWarn
sfpDmiHighRxPowerWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high RX received optical warning threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiHighRxPowerAlarm.name: sfpDmiHighRxPowerAlarm
sfpDmiHighRxPowerAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI high RX received optical alarm threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowRxPowerWarn.name: sfpDmiLowRxPowerWarn
sfpDmiLowRxPowerWarn.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low RX received optical warning threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiLowRxPowerAlarm.name: sfpDmiLowRxPowerAlarm
sfpDmiLowRxPowerAlarm.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI low RX received optical alarm threshold. The value displayed will be either millwatts or Dbm based on your current regional display settings.

sfpDmiStatus2.name: sfpDmiStatus2
sfpDmiStatus2.description: This object identifies the status of the SFP module. If sfpCommFailed value is set then the rest of the data in this entry is invalid 0x80 - sfpModuleInserted 0x40 - sfpCommFailed 0x20 - sfpDmiSupported

sfpDmiVendorSerialNumber.name: sfpDmiVendorSerialNumber
sfpDmiVendorSerialNumber.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI serial number.

sfpDmiVendorName.name: sfpDmiVendorName
sfpDmiVendorName.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI serial number.

sfpDmiVendorPartNumber.name: sfpDmiVendorPartNumber
sfpDmiVendorPartNumber.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI serial number.

xfpDmiAux1Type.name: xfpDmiAux1Type
xfpDmiAux1Type.description: This object identifies the type of value that is being measured by the Auxillary 1 registers on the XFP

xfpDmiAux1State.name: xfpDmiAux1State
xfpDmiAux1State.description: This object identifies current alarm status for the XFP Aux1 registers

xfpDmiRealTimeAux1.name: xfpDmiRealTimeAux1
xfpDmiRealTimeAux1.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI real time values for the Aux1 registers

xfpDmiHighAux1Warn.name: xfpDmiHighAux1Warn
xfpDmiHighAux1Warn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI high warning threshold for Aux1

xfpDmiHighAux1Alarm.name: xfpDmiHighAux1Alarm
xfpDmiHighAux1Alarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI alarm alarm threshold for Aux1

xfpDmiLowAux1Warn.name: xfpDmiLowAux1Warn
xfpDmiLowAux1Warn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low warning threshold for Aux1

xfpDmiLowAux1Alarm.name: xfpDmiLowAux1Alarm
xfpDmiLowAux1Alarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low alarm threshold for Aux1

xfpDmiAux2Type.name: xfpDmiAux2Type
xfpDmiAux2Type.description: This object identifies the type of value that is being measured by the Auxillary 1 registers on the XFP

xfpDmiAux2State.name: xfpDmiAux2State
xfpDmiAux2State.description: This object identifies current alarm status for the XFP Aux2 registers

xfpDmiRealTimeAux2.name: xfpDmiRealTimeAux2
xfpDmiRealTimeAux2.description: This object identifies the SFP DMI real time values for the Aux2 registers

xfpDmiHighAux2Warn.name: xfpDmiHighAux2Warn
xfpDmiHighAux2Warn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI high warning threshold for Aux2

xfpDmiHighAux2Alarm.name: xfpDmiHighAux2Alarm
xfpDmiHighAux2Alarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI alarm alarm threshold for Aux2

xfpDmiLowAux2Warn.name: xfpDmiLowAux2Warn
xfpDmiLowAux2Warn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low warning threshold for Aux2

xfpDmiLowAux2Alarm.name: xfpDmiLowAux2Alarm
xfpDmiLowAux2Alarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low alarm threshold for Aux2

xfpDmiMinBitRate.name: xfpDmiMinBitRate
xfpDmiMinBitRate.description: This object specifies the XFP minimum bit rate.

xfpDmiMaxBitRate.name: xfpDmiMaxBitRate
xfpDmiMaxBitRate.description: This object specifies the XFP maximum bit rate.

xfpDmiReachEBW50125.name: xfpDmiReachEBW50125
xfpDmiReachEBW50125.description: This object specifies the link length that is supported by the fiber transceiver using extended bandwidth 50 micron core (125 micron jacket) multimode fiber

sfpDmiReachCopper.name: sfpDmiReachCopper
sfpDmiReachCopper.description: This object identifies the maximum length in meters that is supported by the SFP/XFP interface using copper cable.

mcrAlarmsWarningsTable.name: mcrAlarmsWarningsTable
mcrAlarmsWarningsTable.description: Table of outstanding alarms and warnings.

mcrAlarmsWarningsEntry.name: mcrAlarmsWarningsEntry
mcrAlarmsWarningsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate alarm or warning.

alarmWarnSequenceIndex.name: alarmWarnSequenceIndex
alarmWarnSequenceIndex.description: This object identifies the sequence in which the alarms or warnings were generated. Gaps in the sequence numbers are normal.

alarmWarnType.name: alarmWarnType
alarmWarnType.description: This object identifies the alert/Trap number associated with this alarm/warning.

alarmWarnSeverity.name: alarmWarnSeverity
alarmWarnSeverity.description: This object identifies the severity level of the alarm/warning. Value will be one of the top three levels.

alarmWarnFlags.name: alarmWarnFlags
alarmWarnFlags.description: This object identifies the flags defining the alarm/warning. 0x00000002 - chassis type alert 0x00000004 - Power Supply Monitoring Unit type alert 0x00000008 - PSMU power supply type alert 0x00000010 - PSMU fan type alert 0x00000020 - Management module type alert 0x00000040 - Media converter module type alert 0x00000080 - Media converter module SFP module type alert.

alarmWarnChassisNum.name: alarmWarnChassisNum
alarmWarnChassisNum.description: This object identifies the chassis number associated with this alarm/warning.

alarmWarnDeviceNum.name: alarmWarnDeviceNum
alarmWarnDeviceNum.description: This object identifies the Hardware slot/bay location of the hardware associated with this alarm or warning. - 0 indicates alarm/warning occurred on the chassis backplane. - If AlarmWarnFlags indicates a power supply then this value the power supply bay number. - Otherwise it is the chassis slot number.

alarmWarnTimeStamp.name: alarmWarnTimeStamp
alarmWarnTimeStamp.description: This object identifies the time stamp of when the alarm/warning was reported. (in seconds since the Epoch, defined as 0:00:00 UTC on the morning of January 1, 1970), that the alert was reported on the MCR-MGT.)

alarmWarnMessage.name: alarmWarnMessage
alarmWarnMessage.description: This object identifies the alarm/warning message string which will contain any values of bound variables.

alarmWarnPortNum.name: alarmWarnPortNum
alarmWarnPortNum.description: This object identifies the location of the media port associated with this alarm or warning.

mcrMediaPortTable.name: mcrMediaPortTable
mcrMediaPortTable.description: Table of general port status information.

mcrMediaPortEntry.name: mcrMediaPortEntry
mcrMediaPortEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate media converter module port.

mediaPortSlotIndex.name: mediaPortSlotIndex
mediaPortSlotIndex.description: Slot number for the media converter module containing this port.

mediaPortPortIndex.name: mediaPortPortIndex
mediaPortPortIndex.description: Port number on media card. Valid values are 1 to the highest number of ports available on a media card. There are usually two ports

moduleModel.name: moduleModel
moduleModel.description: This object identifies the model name of the module containing this port.

portName.name: portName
portName.description: This object identifies the name configured for this port.

portEnable.name: portEnable
portEnable.description: This object indicates whether the port has been enabled.

portType.name: portType
portType.description: The type of port (copper, fiber, etc.) .

portSpeed.name: portSpeed
portSpeed.description: If the port auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the ports current auto-negotiated speed setting. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored

portDuplex.name: portDuplex
portDuplex.description: If port auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current auto-negotiated duplex setting for this port. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

portPause.name: portPause
portPause.description: If port auto-negotiation state is complete then this object indicates the media converter module's current auto-negotiated pause setting for this port. If auto-negotiation is not complete then the value returned should be ignored.

portRemoteStatus.name: portRemoteStatus
portRemoteStatus.description: This port's Link Partner Remote Fault status or Far End Fault status

portMediaType.name: portMediaType
portMediaType.description: The type of port (copper, fiber, etc.) .

portPhysicalProtocol.name: portPhysicalProtocol
portPhysicalProtocol.description: The physical networking protocol used by the port.

systemStatus.name: systemStatus
systemStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

systemName.name: systemName
systemName.description: The name of the system management module.

systemDomainName.name: systemDomainName
systemDomainName.description: The domain name of the management module.

systemIpAddress.name: systemIpAddress
systemIpAddress.description: The management module's unique IPv4 network IP address. If you are using the management module in an IPv6 network, this field can be left blank.

systemSubnetBits.name: systemSubnetBits
systemSubnetBits.description: The number of bits in the subnet mask. For example, a subnet mask of 255.255.0.0 has 16 subnet/prefix bits. Valid values are 0-32. The default is 0. When the value is 0, the correct value is determined based on the class of the IP Address.

systemDHCPUpdateDNS.name: systemDHCPUpdateDNS
systemDHCPUpdateDNS.description: If enabled, the DNS system will be updated after the management module gets the IP address via DHCP.

systemAutoObtainDNS.name: systemAutoObtainDNS
systemAutoObtainDNS.description: If on, the DNS server IP address will be obtained automatically automatically via DHCP.

systemAutoObtainGW.name: systemAutoObtainGW
systemAutoObtainGW.description: If enabled, the default gateway IP address will be get automatically via DHCP.

systemDomainPrefix.name: systemDomainPrefix
systemDomainPrefix.description: The domain prefix for primary Ethernet interface of the management module.

systemTFTPRetry.name: systemTFTPRetry
systemTFTPRetry.description: The number of times the management module will attempt to transfer (using TFTP) a file to/from a host. Default is 5. A value of 0 (zero) means that the management module will not attempt a retry should TFTP fail.

systemTFTPTimeOut.name: systemTFTPTimeOut
systemTFTPTimeOut.description: The time, in seconds, that the management module will wait for a successful transmit or receipt of TFTP packets before retrying a TFTP transfer. Default is 3 seconds.

gatewayEntry.name: gatewayEntry
gatewayEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate configured gateway.

gatewayStatus.name: gatewayStatus
gatewayStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

gatewayHost.name: gatewayHost
gatewayHost.description: You can specify up to twenty hosts to act as gateways in your network. Each gateway host must be defined in the management module host table.

gatewayType.name: gatewayType
gatewayType.description: Specify the type of gateway: Default-A gateway which provides general access beyond your local network. Host-A gateway reserved for accessing a specific host external to your local network. Network-A gateway reserved for accessing a specific network external to your local network.

gatewayIpAddress.name: gatewayIpAddress
gatewayIpAddress.description: When the gateway is a Host or Network gateway, you must specify the IP address of the target host machine/network.

gatewaySubnetBits.name: gatewaySubnetBits
gatewaySubnetBits.description: When the gateway is a Network gateway, you must specify the subnet/prefix bits for that network. If the IP address is IPv4, then the Subnet/Prefix Bits range is 0-32. If the IP address is IPv6, then the Subnet/Prefix Bits range is 0-128.

gatewayInterface.name: gatewayInterface
gatewayInterface.description: The interface that the management module is going to use to access the Remote Host.

hostEntry.name: hostEntry
hostEntry.description: An entry in the host table, each relating to a separate host.

hostIndex.name: hostIndex
hostIndex.description: The table entry number for this host.

hostStatus.name: hostStatus
hostStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

hostName.name: hostName
hostName.description: The host name used for this host entry. To delete an entry, blank out this field. If blank, this entry is currently unused.

hostIpAddr.name: hostIpAddr
hostIpAddr.description: The host IP address used for this entry.

hostFqdn.name: hostFqdn
hostFqdn.description: The host full qualified domain name for the host entry. If blank, this entry is currently unused.

dnsEntry.name: dnsEntry
dnsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate DNS host.

dnsStatus.name: dnsStatus
dnsStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

dnsIpAddress.name: dnsIpAddress
dnsIpAddress.description: You can specify the IP addresses for up to two DNS (Domain Name Servers) hosts in your network. The first DNS entry in the list is the primary DNS and the second DNS entry is the secondary server.

dynamicDNSStatus.name: dynamicDNSStatus
dynamicDNSStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

dynamicDNSPassword.name: dynamicDNSPassword
dynamicDNSPassword.description: This object identifies the dynamic DNS password. Reading of this object will always return a blank string

dynamicDNSWildCard.name: dynamicDNSWildCard
dynamicDNSWildCard.description: Specifies whether to add a alias such as * to your registered host name.

dynamicDNSConnectionMethod.name: dynamicDNSConnectionMethod
dynamicDNSConnectionMethod.description: Specifies how the management module is going to connection to the DynDNS.org server.

dynamicDNSSSLVerifyPeerCertificate.name: dynamicDNSSSLVerifyPeerCertificate
dynamicDNSSSLVerifyPeerCertificate.description: Enable this option when you want the Validation Criteria to match the Peer Certificate for authentication to pass. If you enable this option, you need to download an SSL/TLS certificate authority (CA) list file to the management module. Any values that are entered in the validation criteria must match the peer certificate for an SSL connection; any fields left blank will not be validated against the peer certificate.

dynamicDNSSSLCountry.name: dynamicDNSSSLCountry
dynamicDNSSSLCountry.description: A two character country code; for example, US.

dynamicDNSSSLStateProv.name: dynamicDNSSSLStateProv
dynamicDNSSSLStateProv.description: Up to a 128 character entry for the state/province; for example, IL.

dynamicDNSSSLLocality.name: dynamicDNSSSLLocality
dynamicDNSSSLLocality.description: Up to a 128 character entry for the location; for example, a city.

dynamicDNSSSLOrganisation.name: dynamicDNSSSLOrganisation
dynamicDNSSSLOrganisation.description: Up to a 64 character entry for the organization; for example, Accounting.

dynamicDNSSSLOrganisationUnit.name: dynamicDNSSSLOrganisationUnit
dynamicDNSSSLOrganisationUnit.description: Up to a 64 character entry for the unit in the organization; for example, Payroll.

dynamicDNSSSLCommonName.name: dynamicDNSSSLCommonName
dynamicDNSSSLCommonName.description: Up to a 64 character entry for common name; for example, the host name or fully qualified domain name.

dynamicDNSSSLEmail.name: dynamicDNSSSLEmail
dynamicDNSSSLEmail.description: Up to a 64 character entry for an email address; for example, acct@anycompany.com.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherEntry.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherEntry
dynamicDNSSSLCipherEntry.description: An entry in the dynamicDNSSSLCipherTable, each relating to a cipher entry.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherStatus.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherStatus
dynamicDNSSSLCipherStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherEncryption.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherEncryption
dynamicDNSSSLCipherEncryption.description: SSL Encryption. None is not allowed for priority 1. Any will use the first encryption format that can be negotiated. The default is any.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMin.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMin
dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMin.description: The minimum key size value that will be used for the specified encryption type. The default is 40.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMax.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMax
dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeySizeMax.description: The maximum key size value that will be used for the specified encryption type. The default is 256.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeyExchange.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeyExchange
dynamicDNSSSLCipherKeyExchange.description: The type of key to exchange for the encryption format: Any-Any key exchange that is valid is used (this does not, however, include ADH keys). RSA-This is an RSA key exchange using an RSA key and certificate. EDHRSA-This is an EDH key exchange using an RSA key and certificate. EDHDSS-This is an EDH key exchange using a DSA key and certificate. ADH-This is an anonymous key exchange which does not require a private key or certificate. Choose this key if you do not want to authenticate the peer device, but you want the data encrypted on the SSL/TLS connection. The default is Any.

dynamicDNSSSLCipherHMAC.name: dynamicDNSSSLCipherHMAC
dynamicDNSSSLCipherHMAC.description: Select the key-hashing for message authentication method for your encryption type: Any, MD5, or SHA1. The default is Any.

ipv6serviceStatus.name: ipv6serviceStatus
ipv6serviceStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

serviceAutoDiscovery.name: serviceAutoDiscovery
serviceAutoDiscovery.description: When on, the management module will send out a Router Solicitation message. If a Router Advertisement message is received, the management module will configure the IPv6 address(es) and configuration parameters based on the information contained in the advertisement. If no Router Advertisement message is received, the management module will attempt to connect to a DHCPv6 server to obtain IPv6 addresses and other configuration parameters. Default on.

serviceDHCPv6.name: serviceDHCPv6
serviceDHCPv6.description: When on, requests IPv6 address(es) and configuration information from the DHCPv6 server. Default off.

serviceDHCPv6IPAddresses.name: serviceDHCPv6IPAddresses
serviceDHCPv6IPAddresses.description: When on, the management module will accept IPv6 address(es) from the DHCPv6 server.

serviceDHCPv6NetworkPrefix.name: serviceDHCPv6NetworkPrefix
serviceDHCPv6NetworkPrefix.description: When on, the management module will accept the network prefix from the DHCPv6 server.

serviceDHCPv6AutoObtainDNS.name: serviceDHCPv6AutoObtainDNS
serviceDHCPv6AutoObtainDNS.description: If on, the DNS server IP address will be obtained automatically automatically via DHCP.

ipv6AddressStatus.name: ipv6AddressStatus
ipv6AddressStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

ipv6AddressAddr.name: ipv6AddressAddr
ipv6AddressAddr.description: Either enter a network prefix that the Device Server will use to derive an IPv6 address using the Device Server's MAC address (must turn ipv6AddressAuto1 on) or enter a specific IPv6 address.

ipv6AddressPrefixBits.name: ipv6AddressPrefixBits
ipv6AddressPrefixBits.description: The IPv6 prefix bits of either the network or IPv6 address.

ipv6AddressAuto.name: ipv6AddressAuto
ipv6AddressAuto.description: When on, the management module will derive an IPv6 address from the entered network prefix and the management module's MAC address.

ipv6AddressSendAdvertise.name: ipv6AddressSendAdvertise
ipv6AddressSendAdvertise.description: When on, the management module will include the IPv6 address in router advertisements.

interfacev6StatsEntry.name: interfacev6StatsEntry
interfacev6StatsEntry.description: An entry in the interface IPv6 table

ipv6TunnelStatus.name: ipv6TunnelStatus
ipv6TunnelStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

ipv6TunnelName.name: ipv6TunnelName
ipv6TunnelName.description: The name of the IPv6 tunnel. Maximum 16 alphanumeric characters.

ipv6TunnelMode.name: ipv6TunnelMode
ipv6TunnelMode.description: The method or protocol that is used to create the IPv6 tunnel. o Manual-When specified, the management module will manually create the IPv6 tunnel to the specified Remote Host through the specified Interface. o ip6to4-When specified, the MCR-MGT will broadcast to the multicast address 192.88.99.1 through the specified Interface. When the closest ip6to4 router responds, it will create the IPv6 tunnel, encapsulating and decapsulating IPv6 traffic sent to and from the management module. o Teredo-When specified, the Teredo protocol encapsulates the IPv6 packet as an IPv4 UDP message, allowing it to pass through most network address translator (NAT) boxes and create an IPv6 tunnel to the specified Remote Host (a Teredo server) through the specified Interface. Default is Manual.

ipv6TunnelRemoteHost.name: ipv6TunnelRemoteHost
ipv6TunnelRemoteHost.description: The IPv4 host that can access the IPv6 network when the Mode is Manual. The Teredo server when the Mode is Teredo.

accessServicesStatus.name: accessServicesStatus
accessServicesStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. accessServicesSessInactTimeout.name: accessServicesSessInactTimeout
accessServicesSessInactTimeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the management session inactivity timer will run. When the timer expires, becuase no activity on the management session within the specified time, the management module will reset the management session. A value of 0 (zero), means that the inactivity timer will not expire (the session is open permanently, or until the user logs out).

httpsPassphrase.name: httpsPassphrase
httpsPassphrase.description: This object identifies the HTTPS SSL certificate passphrase. Reading of this object will always return a blank string

sshServerAuthDSA.name: sshServerAuthDSA
sshServerAuthDSA.description: When a client SSH session requests DSA authentication, the management module's SSH server will authenticate the user via DSA

sshServerAuthKeyboard.name: sshServerAuthKeyboard
sshServerAuthKeyboard.description: The user types in a password for authentication.

sshServerAuthPassword.name: sshServerAuthPassword
sshServerAuthPassword.description: The user types in a password for authentication.

sshServerCipher3Des.name: sshServerCipher3Des
sshServerCipher3Des.description: The management module SSH server's 3DES encryption is enable/disabled.

sshServerCipherBlowfish.name: sshServerCipherBlowfish
sshServerCipherBlowfish.description: The management module SSH server's Blowfish encryption is enabled/disabled.

sshServerCipherCipherAES.name: sshServerCipherCipherAES
sshServerCipherCipherAES.description: The management module SSH server's AES encryption is enabled/disabled

sshServerCipherCAST.name: sshServerCipherCAST
sshServerCipherCAST.description: The management module SSH server's CAST encryption is enabled/disabled

sshServerCipherArcfour.name: sshServerCipherArcfour
sshServerCipherArcfour.description: The management module SSH server's Arcfour encryption is enabled/disabled.

sshServerVerbose.name: sshServerVerbose
sshServerVerbose.description: Displays debug messages on the terminal.

sshServerCompression.name: sshServerCompression
sshServerCompression.description: Requests compression of all data. Compression is desirable on slow connections, but will only slow down things on fast networks.

snmpLocation.name: snmpLocation

snmpCommunityEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate SNMP community definition

snmpCommunityIpAddress.description: The IP address of the SNMP manager that will send requests to the management module. If the address is 0.0.0.0, any SNMP manager with the Community Name can access the management module.

snmpCommunityPermission.description: Permits the management module to respond to SNMP requests by: None -There is no response to requests from SNMP. Readonly -Responds only to Read requests from SNMP. Readwrite -Responds to both Read and Write requests from SNMP.

authHostOnly.name: authHostOnly
authHostOnly.description: Determines whether only authorized hosts are allowed to access the management module. If set to yes then the management module will only respond to, and allow access to and from, the IP or MAC addresses of hosts configured in the authorized IP and MAC hosts tables.

authIpHostEntry.description: An entry in the AuthIpHostTable, each relating to a IP host.

localEventLogEnabled.name: localEventLogEnabled
localEventLogEnabled.description: Determines whether alert events are logged to the internal local event log.

localEventLogAlertLevel.name: localEventLogAlertLevel
localEventLogAlertLevel.description: Choose the alert level that will trigger a local event being stored in the local event log. When you select an alert level, all alerts that appear above it in the list will also trigger a local event log message. For example, if you select oneTimeError, all oneTimeError, persistantError, moduleLevelFault, and systemLevelFault alert events will be generate a local event message.

localEventLogClear.name: localEventLogClear
localEventLogClear.description: Writing a yes(1) to this object will clear the local event log on the management module. Reading of this object will always return 0

syslogStatus.name: syslogStatus
