syslogSeverityLevel.name: syslogSeverityLevel
syslogSeverityLevel.description: Choose the severity level that will trigger a syslog message: Emergency, Alert, Critical, Error, Warning, Notice, Info, Debug When you select a severity level, all the levels that appear above it in the list will also trigger a syslog message. For example, if you select Error, all Error, Critical, Alert, and Emergency events will generate a syslog message. NOTE: In addition to alert events, syslog message will also be generated for several non-alert system events

syslogPrimaryHost.name: syslogPrimaryHost
syslogPrimaryHost.description: The first preconfigured host that the management module will attempt to send system log messages to; messages will be displayed on the host's monitor.

syslogSecondaryHost.name: syslogSecondaryHost
syslogSecondaryHost.description: If the management module cannot communicate with the primary host, then the management module will attempt to send system log messages to this preconfigured host; messages will be displayed on the host's monitor.

For example, if you select oneTimeError, all oneTimeError, persistantError, moduleLevelFault, and systemLevelFault alert events will be generate a SNMP trap message.

snmpTrapHostUdpPort.description: Defines the UDP port number the SNMP trap host will listen on to receive trap messages generated by the management module.

snmpTrapHostVersion.name: snmpTrapHostVersion
snmpTrapHostVersion.description: Defines the SNMP version of the traps sent to this host. If snmpTrapV3 is selected then the SNMP trap v3 user

snmpTrapHostType.name: snmpTrapHostType
snmpTrapHostType.description: If set to snmpInform(1) the management module will send traps via an INFORM-PDU, expecting a response from the trap host, retransmitting if required. Otherwise it will send them via a TRAP-PDU or TRAP2-PDU. This object is ignored for for SNMP v1

snmpTrapHostCommunity.name: snmpTrapHostCommunity
snmpTrapHostCommunity.description: An arbitrary trap community name. This object is ignored for SNMP v3

snmpTrapHostEnable.name: snmpTrapHostEnable
snmpTrapHostEnable.description: If set to No, the management module will not use this table entry to send traps.

snmpV3TrapUserSecurityLevel.name: snmpV3TrapUserSecurityLevel
snmpV3TrapUserSecurityLevel.description: SNMP trap v3 user security level.

snmpV3TrapUserAuthAlgorithm.name: snmpV3TrapUserAuthAlgorithm
snmpV3TrapUserAuthAlgorithm.description: SNMP trap v3 user authentication method.

snmpV3TrapUserAuthPasswd.description: SNMP trap v3 user authentication password.

snmpV3TrapUserPrivacyPasswd.description: SNMP trap v3 user privacy password.

snmpTrapGlbHostTimeout.name: snmpTrapGlbHostTimeout
snmpTrapGlbHostTimeout.description: Defines the timeout in miliseconds between retries of sending the SNMP INFORM-PDU if no response is received for the trap host.

snmpTapGlobHostRetries.name: snmpTapGlobHostRetries
snmpTapGlobHostRetries.description: Defines the number of retries to send the SNMP INFORM-PDU trap if no response is received from the trap host.

snmpV3LocalEngineID.name: snmpV3LocalEngineID
snmpV3LocalEngineID.description: An SNMPv3 engine ID used by the MCR-MGT for identification when sending SNMP v3 traps.

snmpV3LocalEngineIDTextSuffix.name: snmpV3LocalEngineIDTextSuffix
snmpV3LocalEngineIDTextSuffix.description: This configured text is used to build the suffix of the SNMPv3 engine ID

mgtAccessMethod.name: mgtAccessMethod
mgtAccessMethod.description: Defines the management protocol used to access the management module

remoteMgtIpAddress.name: remoteMgtIpAddress
remoteMgtIpAddress.description: Defines the remote IP address accessing the management module

remoteTftpHost.name: remoteTftpHost
remoteTftpHost.description: Defines the remote TFTP server IP address or host name performing the TFP file transfer

remoteTftpFileName.name: remoteTftpFileName
remoteTftpFileName.description: Defines the remote TFTP file name

networkIpAddress.name: networkIpAddress
networkIpAddress.description: Defines the IP address assigned to the management module

mcrMediaPortNum.name: mcrMediaPortNum
mcrMediaPortNum.description: This object identifies the media converter module port number.

mcrMediaPortDescr.name: mcrMediaPortDescr
mcrMediaPortDescr.description: A description of the media port that consists of the user defined media port name, followed by the system name for the port.

eventSeverityLevel.name: eventSeverityLevel
eventSeverityLevel.description: The severity level of the event that generated this trap.

xfpDmiRealTimeAux.name: xfpDmiRealTimeAux
xfpDmiRealTimeAux.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI real time values for one of the auxillary register sets.

xfpDmiHighAuxWarn.name: xfpDmiHighAuxWarn
xfpDmiHighAuxWarn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI high warning threshold for one of the auxillary register sets.

xfpDmiHighAuxAlarm.name: xfpDmiHighAuxAlarm
xfpDmiHighAuxAlarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI alarm alarm threshold for one of the auxillary register sets.

xfpDmiLowAuxWarn.name: xfpDmiLowAuxWarn
xfpDmiLowAuxWarn.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low warning threshold for one of the auxillary register sets.

xfpDmiLowAuxAlarm.name: xfpDmiLowAuxAlarm
xfpDmiLowAuxAlarm.description: This object identifies the XFP DMI low alarm threshold for one of the auxillary register sets.

mcrModuleSubTypeInserted.name: mcrModuleSubTypeInserted
mcrModuleSubTypeInserted.description: This object identifies the module sub-type inserted in the slot.

mcrMediaBackedupModuleSubType.name: mcrMediaBackedupModuleSubType
mcrMediaBackedupModuleSubType.description: This object identifies the module sub-type of the backup configuration.

mcrMediaPortBandwidth.name: mcrMediaPortBandwidth
mcrMediaPortBandwidth.description: This object identifies the media converter module port's current bandwith in kbps.

mcrMediaPortBandwidthThreshold.name: mcrMediaPortBandwidthThreshold
mcrMediaPortBandwidthThreshold.description: This object identifies the media converter module port's bandwith threshold in kbps.

emailStatus.name: emailStatus
emailStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

emailEnabled.name: emailEnabled
emailEnabled.description: Determines whether or not email notification is turned on. Default is Off.

emailAlertLevel.name: emailAlertLevel
emailAlertLevel.description: Choose the alert level that will trigger a email message to be sent if alert email is enabled. When you select an alert level, all alerts that appear above it in the list will also trigger a local event log message. For example, if you select oneTimeError, all oneTimeError, persistantError, moduleLevelFault, and systemLevelFault alert events will be generate a email message.

emailTo.name: emailTo
emailTo.description: An email address or list of email addresses that will receive the email notification.

emailFrom.name: emailFrom
emailFrom.description: This field can contain an email address that might identify the management module name or some other value.

emailSMTPHost.name: emailSMTPHost
emailSMTPHost.description: The SMTP host (email server) that will process the email notification request. This can be either a host name defined in the management module host table or the SMTP host IP address.

emailReply.name: emailReply
emailReply.description: The email address to whom all replies to the email notification should go.

emailSubject.name: emailSubject
emailSubject.description: A text string, which can contain spaces, that will display in the Subject field of the email notification.

emailSMTPUsername.name: emailSMTPUsername
emailSMTPUsername.description: The user name for the SMTP server, if the server requires authentication.

emailSMTPPassword.name: emailSMTPPassword
emailSMTPPassword.description: The password for the SMTP server, if the server requires authentication.

emailSMTPEncryption.name: emailSMTPEncryption
emailSMTPEncryption.description: The encryption method for the SMTP server.

emailSMTPValidatePeerCertificate.name: emailSMTPValidatePeerCertificate
emailSMTPValidatePeerCertificate.description: Validate peer SSL/TLS certificate, when SSL or TLS encryption is used.

emailSMTPTcpPort.name: emailSMTPTcpPort
emailSMTPTcpPort.description: The TCP port used for communicating with the SMTP server. For no encryption or TLS encryption, use port 25. For SSL encryption, use port 465.

emailSMTPDomain.name: emailSMTPDomain
emailSMTPDomain.description: The domain for NTLM authentication with the SMTP server, if applicable.

mgtUsersStatus.name: mgtUsersStatus
mgtUsersStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

mgtUsersByPassLoginEnabled.name: mgtUsersByPassLoginEnabled
mgtUsersByPassLoginEnabled.description: Indicates whether by pass login is enabled. When enable users will be automatically login as admin user. The will not be prompted for a user ID or password when accessing the management module.

mgtUsersPrimaryAuthMethod.name: mgtUsersPrimaryAuthMethod
mgtUsersPrimaryAuthMethod.description: The first authentication method that the management module attempts. Some type of authentication must be done by the management module.

mgtUsersSecondaryAuthMethod.name: mgtUsersSecondaryAuthMethod
mgtUsersSecondaryAuthMethod.description: If the Primary Authentication Method fails, the next authentication method that the management module attempts. You can choose to use authentication methods in combination. For example, you can specify the Primary Authentication Method as Local and the Secondary Authentication Method as RADIUS. Therefore, some users can be defined in the Device Server (Local) others in RADIUS.

mgtUsersAlwaysAttemptSecond.name: mgtUsersAlwaysAttemptSecond
mgtUsersAlwaysAttemptSecond.description: If enabled, the secondary authentication method will always be used.

localUserAccountsTable.name: localUserAccountsTable
localUserAccountsTable.description: Table of locally defined user information

localUserAccountsEntry.name: localUserAccountsEntry
localUserAccountsEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to separate user defined locally.

userIndex.name: userIndex
userIndex.description: The table entry number for this user.

userStatus.name: userStatus
userStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

userName.name: userName
userName.description: The user name. To delete a user, set this field to blank. If blank, this entry is currently unused.

userPassword.name: userPassword
userPassword.description: The password for the local user.

userLevel.name: userLevel
userLevel.description: Admin: Total access to the management module. More than one admin user account can exist, but we recommend that you only have one. operator: Full read only access to configuration and limited control commands

localUsersStatusTable.name: localUsersStatusTable
localUsersStatusTable.description: Table of locally defined user information

localUsersStatusEntry.name: localUsersStatusEntry
localUsersStatusEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to separate user defined locally.

userStatusIndex.name: userStatusIndex
userStatusIndex.description: The table entry number for this user status.

userStatusName.name: userStatusName
userStatusName.description: The user name. To delete a user, set this field to blank. If blank, this entry is currently unused.

userStatusMgtAccessType.name: userStatusMgtAccessType
userStatusMgtAccessType.description: Defines the management protocol used to access the management module

userStatusRemoteIPAddress.name: userStatusRemoteIPAddress
userStatusRemoteIPAddress.description: This object specifies the remote IP address user management session.

userStatusStartTime.name: userStatusStartTime
userStatusStartTime.description: This object identifies the date and time that the current user's management session started.

userStatusLevel.name: userStatusLevel
userStatusLevel.description: Admin: Total access to the management module. More than one admin user account can exist, but we recommend that you only have one. operator: Full read only access to configuration and limited control commands

radiusStatus.name: radiusStatus
radiusStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

radiusAuthenticationPort.name: radiusAuthenticationPort
radiusAuthenticationPort.description: The port that the RADIUS host listens to for authentication requests. The default port is 1812.

radiusPrimaryAcctHost.name: radiusPrimaryAcctHost
radiusPrimaryAcctHost.description: Name of the primary RADIUS authentication host.

radiusSecondaryAcctHost.name: radiusSecondaryAcctHost
radiusSecondaryAcctHost.description: Name of the secondary RADIUS authentication host.

radiusAccountingPort.name: radiusAccountingPort
radiusAccountingPort.description: The port that the RADIUS host listens to for accounting requests. The default port is 1813.

radiusRetryLimit.name: radiusRetryLimit
radiusRetryLimit.description: The number of times the management module tries to connect to the RADIUS server before erroring out. Valid values are 0-255. The default is 5.

radiusTimeout.name: radiusTimeout
radiusTimeout.description: The time, in seconds, that the management module waits to receive a reply after sending out a request to a RADIUS accounting or authentication host. If no reply is received before the timeout period expires, the management module will retry the same host up to and including the number of retry attempts. Valid values are 1-255. The default is 3 seconds.

radiusNasIdentifier.name: radiusNasIdentifier
radiusNasIdentifier.description: The NAS identifier name. To delete this , set this field to blank.

radiusNasIpAddress.name: radiusNasIpAddress
radiusNasIpAddress.description: When on, the NAS Identifier obtains ipv4 address automatically. Default is on.

radiusNasSpecifyIpAddress.name: radiusNasSpecifyIpAddress
radiusNasSpecifyIpAddress.description: Specify the unique IPv4 address that NAS Identifier will use

radiusNasIpv6Address.name: radiusNasIpv6Address
radiusNasIpv6Address.description: When on, the NAS Identifier obtains ipv6 address automatically. Default is on.

radiusNasSpecifyIpv6Address.name: radiusNasSpecifyIpv6Address
radiusNasSpecifyIpv6Address.description: Specify the unique IPv6 address that NAS Identifier will use

kerberosStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

kerberosRealm.name: kerberosRealm
kerberosRealm.description: The Kerberos realm is the Kerberos host domain name, in upper-case letters.

kerberosDomain.name: kerberosDomain
kerberosDomain.description: The name of a host running the KDC (Key Distribution Center) for the specified realm. The host name that you specify must either be defined in the management module's host Table before the last reboot or be resolved by DNS.

kerberosPort.name: kerberosPort
kerberosPort.description: The port that the Kerberos server listens to for authentication requests. If no port is specified, the default port 88 is used.

ldapStatus.name: ldapStatus
ldapStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

ldapHost.name: ldapHost
ldapHost.description: The name or IP address of the LDAP host. If you use a host name, that host must either have been defined in the management module's Host Table before the last reboot or be resolved by DNS. If you are using TLS, you must enter the same string you used to create the LDAP certificate.

ldapPort.name: ldapPort
ldapPort.description: The port that the LDAP host listens to for authentication requests. The default port is 389.

ldapBase.name: ldapBase
ldapBase.description: The domain component (dc) that is the starting point for the search for user authentication.

ldapEnableTLS.name: ldapEnableTLS
ldapEnableTLS.description: Enables/disables the Transport Layer Security (TLS) with the LDAP host.

ldapTLSPort.name: ldapTLSPort
ldapTLSPort.description: Specify the port number that LDAP will use for TLS. The default is port 636.

ldapUID.name: ldapUID
ldapUID.description: LDAP user attribute. e.g. uid (OpenLDAP) sAMAccountName (Active Directory) The default is 'uid'.

ldapClientName.name: ldapClientName
ldapClientName.description: LDAP client name. Identifies the unit to the LDAP server, when client authentication is .

ldapClientAppendBase.name: ldapClientAppendBase
ldapClientAppendBase.description: Append base to LDAP client name.

ldapClientPassword.name: ldapClientPassword
ldapClientPassword.description: LDAP client password. Identifies the unit to the LDAP server, when client authentication is .

tacacsPrimaryHost.name: tacacsPrimaryHost
tacacsPrimaryHost.description: The primary TACACS+ host that is used for authentication.

tacacsSecondaryHost.name: tacacsSecondaryHost
tacacsSecondaryHost.description: The secondary TACACS+ host that is used for authentication, should the primary TACACS+ host fail to respond.

tacacsPort.name: tacacsPort
tacacsPort.description: The port number that TACACS+ listens to for authentication requests. The default port number is 49.

tacacsAccountingPrimaryHost.name: tacacsAccountingPrimaryHost
tacacsAccountingPrimaryHost.description: The primary TACACS+ accounting host that is used for.

tacacsAccountingSecondaryHost.name: tacacsAccountingSecondaryHost
tacacsAccountingSecondaryHost.description: The secondary TACACS+ accounting host that is used for , should the primary TACACS+ host fail to respond.

tacacsAccountingPort.name: tacacsAccountingPort
tacacsAccountingPort.description: The port number that TACACS+ listens to for accounting requests. The default port number is 49.

tacacsAlternateServiceNames.name: tacacsAlternateServiceNames
tacacsAlternateServiceNames.description: Enable alternate service names for TACACS+.

securidStatus.name: securidStatus

Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. securidMasterHost.name: securidMasterHost
securidMasterHost.description: The first SecurID server that is tried for user authentication.

securidSlaveHost.name: securidSlaveHost
securidSlaveHost.description: If the first SecurID server does not respond to an authentication request, this is the next SecurID server that is tried for user authentication.

securidPort.name: securidPort
securidPort.description: The port number that SecurID listens to for authentication requests. The default port number is 5500.

securidType.name: securidType
securidType.description: You can specify either SDI or DES encryption for SecurID server communication. The default is SDI encryption.

securidLegacy.name: securidLegacy
securidLegacy.description: If you are running SecurID 3.x or 4.x, you need to run in Legacy Mode. If you are running SecurID 5.x or above, do not select Legacy Mode.

nisSecondaryHost.name: nisSecondaryHost
nisSecondaryHost.description: The secondary NIS host that is used for authentication, should the primary NIS host fail to respond.

systemTime.name: systemTime
systemTime.description: The system time (local time). Format hh:mm:ss.

systemDateTimeAndOffset.name: systemDateTimeAndOffset
systemDateTimeAndOffset.description: This read only object identifies the current system date, time and GMT offset. The date and time will be displayed in the regional time format configured.

timeZoneListEnable.name: timeZoneListEnable
timeZoneListEnable.description: When the time zone list is enabled then the time zone being use is the one selected form the predefined list of time zones. If not enabled then the customTimeZoneGroup will define the time zone being used

selectionFromTimeZoneList.name: selectionFromTimeZoneList
selectionFromTimeZoneList.description: This object identifies the predefined time zone selected. This time zone will be used if timeZoneListEnable object is set to yes. configured.

timeZoneAdjustForDST.name: timeZoneAdjustForDST
timeZoneAdjustForDST.description: This object identifies if the time will be adjusted for DST (Daylight Savings Time) or not.

customTimeZoneStatus.name: customTimeZoneStatus
customTimeZoneStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

timeZoneName.name: timeZoneName
timeZoneName.description: The name of the time zone when using standard time.

timeOffset.name: timeOffset
timeOffset.description: The offset of summer time from standard time in minutes.

timeSummerName.name: timeSummerName
timeSummerName.description: The name of the time zone when using summer time.

timeSummerOffset.name: timeSummerOffset
timeSummerOffset.description: The offset of summer time from standard time in minutes.

timeSummerMode.name: timeSummerMode
timeSummerMode.description: You can configure the summer time to take effect: None-No summer time change. Fixed-The summer time change goes into effect at the specified time every year. For example, April 15 at 1:00 pm. Recurring-The summer time changes goes into effect every year at same relative time. For example, on the third week in April on a Tuesday at 1:00 pm.

timeSummerRecStartMonth.name: timeSummerRecStartMonth
timeSummerRecStartMonth.description: The recurring summer time start month.

timeSummerRecStartWeek.name: timeSummerRecStartWeek
timeSummerRecStartWeek.description: The recurring summer time start week.

timeSummerRecStartDay.name: timeSummerRecStartDay
timeSummerRecStartDay.description: The recurring summer time start day.

timeSummerRecStartHour.name: timeSummerRecStartHour
timeSummerRecStartHour.description: The recurring summer time start hour.

timeSummerRecStartMin.name: timeSummerRecStartMin
timeSummerRecStartMin.description: The recurring summer time start minute

timeSummerFixStartDay.name: timeSummerFixStartDay
timeSummerFixStartDay.description: The fixed summer time start day

timeSummerFixStartHour.name: timeSummerFixStartHour
timeSummerFixStartHour.description: The fixed summer time start hour

timeSummerFixStartMinute.name: timeSummerFixStartMinute
timeSummerFixStartMinute.description: The fixed summer time start minute

timeSummerFixEndMonth.name: timeSummerFixEndMonth
timeSummerFixEndMonth.description: The fixed summer time End month

timeSummerFixEndDay.name: timeSummerFixEndDay
timeSummerFixEndDay.description: The fixed summer time End day

timeSummerFixEndHour.name: timeSummerFixEndHour
timeSummerFixEndHour.description: The fixed summer time End hour

timeSummerFixEndMinute.name: timeSummerFixEndMinute
timeSummerFixEndMinute.description: The fixed summer time End minute

timeSntpMode.name: timeSntpMode

timeSntpHost1.name: timeSntpHost1
timeSntpHost1.description: The first remote SNTP host name that the device server communicates with.

timeSntpHost2.name: timeSntpHost2
timeSntpHost2.description: The second remote SNTP host name that the device server communicates with.

sntpStatAddress.name: sntpStatAddress

sntpStatLastUpdate.name: sntpStatLastUpdate

timeSntpServerAuthentication.name: timeSntpServerAuthentication

timeSntpKeyID.name: timeSntpKeyID

timeSntpKeyID2.name: timeSntpKeyID2
timeSntpKeyID2.description: Specifies the key ID to use for host 2 during server authentication.

fileFirmwareName.name: fileFirmwareName
fileFirmwareName.description: The path and file name (do not use a drive letter), relative to the default path of your TFTP server software, of the update software for the management module that will be loaded when the management module is rebooted.

fileConfigurationHost.name: fileConfigurationHost
fileConfigurationHost.description: The host name or IP address of the server that contains the configuration file. If you use a host name, it must exist in the management module's host table or be resolved by DNS.

fileConfigurationName.name: fileConfigurationName
fileConfigurationName.description: The path and file name (do not use a drive letter), relative to the default path of your TFTP server software, of the new configuration file for the Device Server that will be loaded when the management module is rebooted.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-100 modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm110.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm110
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm110.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-110 modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000OrCm100.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000OrCm1000Sfp
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000OrCm100.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-1000 or CM-1000-SFP modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-1110 modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110Sfp.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110Sfp
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1110Sfp.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-1110-SFP modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100mm.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100mm
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm100mm.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-100MM modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000mm.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000mm
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm1000mm.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-1000MM modules.

firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm10g.name: firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm10g
firmwareUpdateBundleVersionCm10g.description: This object identifies the bundled firmware version for CM-10G modules.

nettxfrTable.name: nettxfrTable
nettxfrTable.description: Table of snmp file transfer sessions.

nettxfrEntry.name: nettxfrEntry
nettxfrEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a SNMP file transfer session.

nettxfrSessionID.name: nettxfrSessionID
nettxfrSessionID.description: This indicates if the net transfer is to be loaded to the management module or saved from the management module.

nettxfrStatus.name: nettxfrStatus
nettxfrStatus.description: This field indicates the status of the nettxfr process. A value of start(1) should be written to this field to start the nettxfr process with the specified parameters in the rest of this group.

nettxfrDirection.name: nettxfrDirection
nettxfrDirection.description: This indicates if the net transfer is to be loaded to the management module or saved from the management module.

nettxfrFileType.name: nettxfrFileType
nettxfrFileType.description: This indicates the type of file to be transfered to/from the management module.

nettxfrFileHost.name: nettxfrFileHost
nettxfrFileHost.description: The host name or IP address of the server that contains the file to be transfered to/from the management module.. If you use a host name, it must exist in the management module's host table or be resolved by DNS.

nettxfrFileName.name: nettxfrFileName
nettxfrFileName.description: The path and file name (do not use a drive letter), relative to the default path of your TFTP server software, of the file to be transfered to/from the management module.

nettxfrMCSlotNumber.name: nettxfrMCSlotNumber
nettxfrMCSlotNumber.description: Specifies the slot number of the Media Converter Module to which the firmware will be transfered.

nettxfrUserName.name: nettxfrUserName
nettxfrUserName.description: Specifies the user login name who owns the ssh public key that is to be transfered to the management module.

nettxfrSSHKeyType.name: nettxfrSSHKeyType
nettxfrSSHKeyType.description: Specifies the authentication method used by the ssh-server public key that is to be transfered to/from the management module

nettxfrSSLType.name: nettxfrSSLType
nettxfrSSLType.description: Specifies the type of SSL file to be transfered to the management module. These files are needed if you are using the secure version of the WebManager (HTTPS), or LDAP authentication with TLS.

nettxfrSessionInUse.name: nettxfrSessionInUse
nettxfrSessionInUse.description: Specifies whether this net transfer session entry is in use. If a manager tries to write a 1 to this field and the session is already in use, then an error is returned.

nettxfrTftpPort.name: nettxfrTftpPort
nettxfrTftpPort.description: Specifies a UDP port number for the TFTP host server. Default is 69.

adminFunction.name: adminFunction
adminFunction.description: Perform a specific function on the management module. If you want to save all the changes that have been submitted to the management module, you need to expand the adminGroup container folder and SET the adminFunction to 1 to write to FLASH. To make the configuration changes take effect, SET the adminFunction to 3 to reboot the management module.

adminStatus.name: adminStatus
adminStatus.description: The status of the last function performed.

adminbootReason.name: adminbootReason
adminbootReason.description: The reason(s) why the management module last rebooted.

adminDiagFileAvailable.name: adminDiagFileAvailable
adminDiagFileAvailable.description: This object indicates that a diagnostic file is available.

displayFormatStatus.name: displayFormatStatus
displayFormatStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

cfgTemperatureUnits.name: cfgTemperatureUnits
cfgTemperatureUnits.description: This object identifies the units to display any internally measured temperature. The units can be Celsius or Fahrenheit.

cfgSfpPowerUnits.name: cfgSfpPowerUnits
cfgSfpPowerUnits.description: This object identifies the units to display any SFP DMI internally measured transmit/receive power. The units can be milliwatts (mW) or Decibel milliwatts (dBm).

cfgTimeFormat.name: cfgTimeFormat
cfgTimeFormat.description: This object identifies the format to display the time.

cfgDateFormat.name: cfgDateFormat
cfgDateFormat.description: This object identifies the format to display date.

mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleTable.name: mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleTable
mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleTable.description: Table of power schedule configuration for chassis slots. (Not applicable to 2-slot chassis.)

mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleEntry.name: mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleEntry
mgtChassisSlotPowerScheduleEntry.description: Entries of the table, each relating to a separate slot in a chassis.

powerSchedSlotIndex.name: powerSchedSlotIndex
powerSchedSlotIndex.description: This object identifies the chassis slot number.

powerSchedDayOfWeek.name: powerSchedDayOfWeek
powerSchedDayOfWeek.description: This object identifies the day of the week.

powerSchedConifgStatus.name: powerSchedConifgStatus
powerSchedConifgStatus.description: When you perform a GET on this variable, one of the following values will be returned: 1-Indicates that the container folder is active with no changes. 2-Indicates that the container folder is active with change(s). Once you have completed setting the variables in a folder, you will want to submit your changes to the management module. To do this, set the Status variable to 4. If you want to discard the changes, set the Status variable to 6. 4-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be submitted to the management module and verified. To save the changes to flash a write of writeToFlash(1) in the adminFunction object is required. 6-Indicates that the changes in the container folder are to be discarded.

powerSchedOnHour.name: powerSchedOnHour
powerSchedOnHour.description: This object identifies the hour (0-23) of the day to schedule a power on of the chassis slot

powerSchedOnMinute.name: powerSchedOnMinute
powerSchedOnMinute.description: This object identifies the minute (0-59) of the hour to schedule a power on of the chassis slot

powerSchedOffHour.name: powerSchedOffHour
powerSchedOffHour.description: This object identifies the hour (0-23) of the day to schedule a power off of the chassis slot

powerSchedOffMinute.name: powerSchedOffMinute
powerSchedOffMinute.description: This object identifies the minute (0-59) of the hour to schedule a power off of the chassis slot

mcrMgtModuleInserted.name: mcrMgtModuleInserted
mcrMgtModuleInserted.description: Trap being sent indicates that a management module has been inserted int the chassis.

mcrMgtSystemBoot.name: mcrMgtSystemBoot
mcrMgtSystemBoot.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module's system firmware is being booted up and has completed system initialization. In some case this alert will indicate a cold start like a user resetting the management module or warm start if the module automatically resets because of a detected crash.

mcrMgtReset.name: mcrMgtReset
mcrMgtReset.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module has been manually reset via the reset button or one of the managers.

mcrMgtResetFactory.name: mcrMgtResetFactory
mcrMgtResetFactory.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module has been manually reset to factory by holding the reset button for 3 or more seconds, or one of the managers. This means that any files downloaded to the management module will be erase and the management configuration file is reset back to the default configuration.

mcrMgtEtheLinkUp.name: mcrMgtEtheLinkUp
mcrMgtEtheLinkUp.description: Trap being sent indicates that the current link status of the Ethernet port on the management module is up.

mcrMgtEtheLinkDown.name: mcrMgtEtheLinkDown
mcrMgtEtheLinkDown.description: Trap being sent indicates that the current link status of the Ethernet port on the management module is down.

mcrMgtConMonDSRSigChg.name: mcrMgtConMonDSRSigChg
mcrMgtConMonDSRSigChg.description: Trap being sent indicates that monitor console DSR is configured and the status of one of these signal has changed on the console port.

mcrMgtAuthFail.name: mcrMgtAuthFail
mcrMgtAuthFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that a user failed authentication via Telnet, SSH, WebManager, SNMP or the serial console.

mcrMgtAuthSuccess.name: mcrMgtAuthSuccess
mcrMgtAuthSuccess.description: Trap being sent indicates that a user failed authentication via Telnet, SSH, WebManager or the serial console.

mcrMgtDateTimeChg.name: mcrMgtDateTimeChg
mcrMgtDateTimeChg.description: Trap being sent indicates that the system date and/or time has been changed.

mcrMgtSntpServFail.name: mcrMgtSntpServFail
mcrMgtSntpServFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that SNTP is configured and the management module can not communicate with the configured SNTP server.

mcrMgtSntpServRec.name: mcrMgtSntpServRec
mcrMgtSntpServRec.description: Trap being sent indicates that the SNTP is configured and the management module has recovered communications with the configured SNTP server.

mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostFail.name: mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostFail
mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that SNMP traps is and the management module can not communicate with the configured SNMP trap host. This trap will only be sent for SNMP trap hosts configured for 'Inform' type traps.

mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostRec.name: mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostRec
mcrMgtSnmpTrapHostRec.description: Trap being sent indicates that SNMP traps is and the management module has recovered communications with the configured SNMP trap host.

mcrMgtEmailServFail.name: mcrMgtEmailServFail
mcrMgtEmailServFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that an alert email server is configured and the management module can not communicate with the configured email server.

mcrMgtEmailServRec.name: mcrMgtEmailServRec
mcrMgtEmailServRec.description: Trap being sent indicates that an alert email server is configured and the management module has recovered communications with the configured email server.

mcrMgtConfSavedFlash.name: mcrMgtConfSavedFlash
mcrMgtConfSavedFlash.description: Trap being sent indicates that the configuration has been saved to flash on the management module.

mcrMgtIpAddrDynChg.name: mcrMgtIpAddrDynChg
mcrMgtIpAddrDynChg.description: Trap being sent indicates that the system IP address has been dynamically changed.

mcrMgtTftpUploadFail.name: mcrMgtTftpUploadFail
mcrMgtTftpUploadFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to transfer a file via TFTP, off the management module to a remote host has failed.

mcrMgtTftpUploadSuccess.name: mcrMgtTftpUploadSuccess
mcrMgtTftpUploadSuccess.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to transfer a file via TFTP, off the management module to a remote host was successful.

mcrMgtTftpDownloadFail.name: mcrMgtTftpDownloadFail
mcrMgtTftpDownloadFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to transfer a file via TFTP, from a remote host to the management module has failed.

mcrMgtTftpDownloadSuccess.name: mcrMgtTftpDownloadSuccess
mcrMgtTftpDownloadSuccess.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to transfer a file via TFTP, from a remote host to the management module was successful.

mcrMgtChassisMismatch.name: mcrMgtChassisMismatch
mcrMgtChassisMismatch.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module has been inserted into a chassis that does not match it's Backup media converter module configuration. Backup media module configurations will be reset to factory default.

mcrChassisAdd.name: mcrChassisAdd
mcrChassisAdd.description: Trap being sent indicates that a new chassis as been added to the chain of chassis.

mcrChassisRemove.name: mcrChassisRemove
mcrChassisRemove.description: Trap being sent indicates that that a chassis has been removed from the chain of chassis.

mcrChassisReset.name: mcrChassisReset
mcrChassisReset.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis back-plane has been manually reset by a user managing the unit.

mcrChassisTemperatureAlarm.name: mcrChassisTemperatureAlarm
mcrChassisTemperatureAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis temperature has exceeded the configured high temperature threshold temperature.

mcrChassisTemperatureRecover.name: mcrChassisTemperatureRecover
mcrChassisTemperatureRecover.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis temperature has recovered back to normal operating temperature.

mcrChassisSlotPoweredOn.name: mcrChassisSlotPoweredOn
mcrChassisSlotPoweredOn.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis slot has been powered off either manually or through the configured chassis slot power schedule.

mcrChassisSlotPoweredOff.name: mcrChassisSlotPoweredOff
mcrChassisSlotPoweredOff.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis slot has been powered on either manually or through the configured chassis slot power schedule.

mcrChassisFail.name: mcrChassisFail
mcrChassisFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module has detected a failure condition in the chassis.

mcrChassisOk.name: mcrChassisOk
mcrChassisOk.description: Trap being sent indicates that the chassis has recovered from a failure and is now operating normally.

mcrPsmuInserted.name: mcrPsmuInserted
mcrPsmuInserted.description: Trap being sent indicates that a power supply has been inserted into the chassis.

mcrPsmuRemoved.name: mcrPsmuRemoved
mcrPsmuRemoved.description: Trap being sent indicates that a power supply's has been removed from the chassis.

mcrPsmuPsuFail.name: mcrPsmuPsuFail
mcrPsmuPsuFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the power supply has failed it's self-test diagnostics.

mcrPsmuPsuOk.name: mcrPsmuPsuOk
mcrPsmuPsuOk.description: Trap being sent indicates that the power supply has passed it's self-test diagnostics.

mcrPsmuPsuVoltageFail.name: mcrPsmuPsuVoltageFail
mcrPsmuPsuVoltageFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the voltage being supplied by the indicated power supply is insufficient.

mcrPsmuPsuVoltageOk.name: mcrPsmuPsuVoltageOk
mcrPsmuPsuVoltageOk.description: Trap being sent indicates that the voltage being supplied by the indicated power supply is now in the normal operating range.

mcrPsmuFanFail.name: mcrPsmuFanFail
mcrPsmuFanFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the fan has failed.

mcrPsmuFanOk.name: mcrPsmuFanOk
mcrPsmuFanOk.description: Trap being sent indicates that the fan currently operating normally.

mcrMediaInserted.name: mcrMediaInserted
mcrMediaInserted.description: Trap being sent indicates that a media converter module has been inserted into the chassis.

mcrMediaRemoved.name: mcrMediaRemoved
mcrMediaRemoved.description: Trap being sent indicates that a media converter module has been removed from the chassis.

mcrMediaReset.name: mcrMediaReset
mcrMediaReset.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module has been manually reset by a user managing the unit.

mcrMediaLostCommunication.name: mcrMediaLostCommunication
mcrMediaLostCommunication.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module can no longer communicate with the media converter module

mcrMediaRecovCommunication.name: mcrMediaRecovCommunication
mcrMediaRecovCommunication.description: Trap being sent indicates that the management module recovered communication with a media converter module

mcrMediaFail.name: mcrMediaFail
mcrMediaFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module has failed its self-test diagnostics

mcrMediaOk.name: mcrMediaOk
mcrMediaOk.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module has passed its self-test diagnostics

mcrMediaLinkUp.name: mcrMediaLinkUp
mcrMediaLinkUp.description: Trap being sent indicates that the current link status of the Fiber or Copper port on the media converter module is up.

mcrMediaLinkDown.name: mcrMediaLinkDown
mcrMediaLinkDown.description: Trap being sent indicates that the current link status of the Fiber or Copper port on the media converter module is down.

mcrMediaConfUpdateFail.name: mcrMediaConfUpdateFail
mcrMediaConfUpdateFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the configuration update on the media converter module has failed.

mcrMediaConfUpdateSuccess.name: mcrMediaConfUpdateSuccess
mcrMediaConfUpdateSuccess.description: Trap being sent indicates that the configuration update on the media converter module was successful. The media converter module configuration can be updated manually or automatically.

mcrMediaConfMismatch.name: mcrMediaConfMismatch
mcrMediaConfMismatch.description: Trap being sent indicates that a chassis slot is configured with Backup/Restore and the media converter module type configured for the slot does not match the media converter module type inserted into the slot.

mcrMediaConfMismatchResolv.name: mcrMediaConfMismatchResolv
mcrMediaConfMismatchResolv.description: Trap being sent indicates that a user has taken action to resolved media converter module configuration mismatch

mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateFail.name: mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateFail
mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to update a media converter module's firmware has Failed.

mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateSuccess.name: mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateSuccess
mcrMediaFirmwareUpdateSuccess.description: Trap being sent indicates that an attempt to update a media converter module's firmware was successful.

mcrSfpInserted.name: mcrSfpInserted
mcrSfpInserted.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module has been inserted into a media converter module

mcrSfpRemoved.name: mcrSfpRemoved
mcrSfpRemoved.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module has been removed from a media converter module

mcrSfpHighTempWarn.name: mcrSfpHighTempWarn
mcrSfpHighTempWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has exceeded the high temperature warning threshold.

mcrSfpHighTempWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTempWarnRecov
mcrSfpHighTempWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighTempAlarm.name: mcrSfpHighTempAlarm
mcrSfpHighTempAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has exceeded the high temperature alarm threshold.

mcrSfpHighTempAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTempAlarmRecov
mcrSfpHighTempAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTempWarn.name: mcrSfpLowTempWarn
mcrSfpLowTempWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has gone below the low temperature warning threshold.

mcrSfpLowTempWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTempWarnRecov
mcrSfpLowTempWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTempAlarm.name: mcrSfpLowTempAlarm
mcrSfpLowTempAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has gone below the low temperature alarm threshold.

mcrSfpLowTempAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTempAlarmRecov
mcrSfpLowTempAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's temperature has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighVoltWarn.name: mcrSfpHighVoltWarn
mcrSfpHighVoltWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has exceeded the high voltage warning threshold.

mcrSfpHighVoltWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpHighVoltWarnRecov
mcrSfpHighVoltWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighVoltAlarm.name: mcrSfpHighVoltAlarm
mcrSfpHighVoltAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has exceeded the high voltage alarm threshold.

mcrSfpHighVoltAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpHighVoltAlarmRecov
mcrSfpHighVoltAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowVoltWarn.name: mcrSfpLowVoltWarn
mcrSfpLowVoltWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has gone below the low voltage warning threshold.

mcrSfpLowVoltWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpLowVoltWarnRecov
mcrSfpLowVoltWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowVoltAlarm.name: mcrSfpLowVoltAlarm
mcrSfpLowVoltAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has gone below the low voltage alarm threshold.

mcrSfpLowVoltAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpLowVoltAlarmRecov
mcrSfpLowVoltAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's voltage has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarn.name: mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarn
mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has exceeded the high TX Bias current warning threshold.

mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarnRecov
mcrSfpHighTxBiasWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarm.name: mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarm
mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has exceeded the high TX Bias current alarm threshold.

mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarmRecov
mcrSfpHighTxBiasAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarn.name: mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarn
mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has gone below the low Tx Bias current warning threshold.

mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarnRecov
mcrSfpLowTxBiasWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarm.name: mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarm
mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has gone below the low Tx Bias current alarm threshold.

mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarmRecov
mcrSfpLowTxBiasAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX Bias current has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarn.name: mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarn
mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has exceeded the high TX power warning threshold.

mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarnRecov
mcrSfpHighTxPowerWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarm.name: mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarm
mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has exceeded the high TX power alarm threshold.

mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarmRecov
mcrSfpHighTxPowerAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarn.name: mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarn
mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has gone below the low TX power warning threshold.

mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarnRecov
mcrSfpLowTxPowerWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarm.name: mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarm
mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has gone below the low TX power alarm threshold.

mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarmRecov
mcrSfpLowTxPowerAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's TX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarn.name: mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarn
mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has exceeded the high RX power warning threshold.

mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarnRecov
mcrSfpHighRxPowerWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarm.name: mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarm
mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has exceeded the high RX power alarm threshold.

mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarmRecov
mcrSfpHighRxPowerAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarn.name: mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarn
mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarn.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has gone below the low RX power warning threshold.

mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarnRecov.name: mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarnRecov
mcrSfpLowRxPowerWarnRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarm.name: mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarm
mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarm.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has gone below the low RX power alarm threshold.

mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarmRecov.name: mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarmRecov
mcrSfpLowRxPowerAlarmRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that a SFP module's RX power has recovered to normal operating level.

mcrChassisCommTempSensorFail.name: mcrChassisCommTempSensorFail
mcrChassisCommTempSensorFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that communication with the chassis temperature sensor has failed. The current chassis temperature reading will be unknown

mcrChassisCommTempSensorRecov.name: mcrChassisCommTempSensorRecov
mcrChassisCommTempSensorRecov.description: Trap being sent indicates that communication with the chassis temperature sensor has recovered.

mcrMediaDetectFail.name: mcrMediaDetectFail
mcrMediaDetectFail.description: Trap being sent indicates that the indicated media card is being powered down due to the detection of a hardware failure.

mcrMediaBadImage.name: mcrMediaBadImage
mcrMediaBadImage.description: Trap being sent indicates that the CRC of the media converter module firmware is incorrect. This can be caused if there is no image on the module or the image is corrupt.

mcrSfpLostComm.name: mcrSfpLostComm
mcrSfpLostComm.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module's microcode can no longer communicate with the SFP module.

mcrSfpRecovComm.name: mcrSfpRecovComm
mcrSfpRecovComm.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module's microcode had previously lost communication with, but has now regained communication with the SFP module.

mcrModuleNotSupported.name: mcrModuleNotSupported
mcrModuleNotSupported.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module is not fully supported by the management module. Update the management module firmware to rectify this issue.

mcrModuleFirmwareUpdate.name: mcrModuleFirmwareUpdate
mcrModuleFirmwareUpdate.description: Trap being sent indicates that the media converter module firmware is being updated.

mcrSfpPortShutdown.name: mcrSfpPortShutdown
